[CLS] the 1933 treasure coast hurricane was the second @ - @ most intense tropical cyclone to strike the united states during the active 1933 atlantic hurricane season . [SEP] the eleventh tropical storm , fifth hurricane , and the third major hurricane of the season , it formed east @ - @ northeast of the leeward islands on august 31 . [SEP]
[CLS] the tropical storm moved rapidly west @ - @ northwestward , steadily intensifying to a hurricane . [SEP] it acquired peak winds of 140 miles per hour ( 225 km / h ) and passed over portions of the bahamas on september 3 , including eleuthera and harbour island , causing severe damage to crops , buildings , and infrastructure . [SEP]
[CLS] winds over 100 mph ( 161 km / h ) affected many islands in its path , especially those that encountered its center , and many wharves were ruined . [SEP] subsequently , it weakened and made landfall at jupiter , florida , early on september 4 with winds of 125 mph ( 201 km / h ) . [SEP]
[CLS] the hurricane moved across the state , passing near tampa before moving into georgia and dissipating . [SEP] in florida , the strong winds of the cyclone blew buildings off their foundations , and numerous trees were prostrated in citrus groves . [SEP]
[CLS] the treasure coast region received the most extensive destruction , and stuart , jupiter , and fort pierce were heavily damaged . [SEP] inland , the cyclone weakened rapidly but produced prodigious amounts of rain , causing a dam to collapse near tampa . [SEP]
[CLS] the storm caused $ 3 million in damage ( 1933 usd ) after damaging or destroying 6 @ , @ 848 homes . [SEP] unusually , the storm hit florida less than 24 hours before another major hurricane bearing 125 @ - @ mile @ - @ per @ - @ hour ( 201 km / h ) winds struck south texas ; never have two major cyclones hit the united states in such close succession . [SEP]
[CLS] the origins of the hurricane were from a tropical wave that possibly spawned a tropical depression on august 27 , although there was minimal data over the next few days as it tracked to the west @ - @ northwest . [SEP] on august 31 , a nearby ship reported gale force winds , which indicated that a tropical storm had developed to the east @ - @ northeast of the lesser antilles . [SEP]
[CLS] based on continuity , it is estimated the storm attained hurricane status later that day . [SEP] moving quickly to the west @ - @ northwest , the storm passed north of the lesser antilles and puerto rico . [SEP]
[CLS] early on september 2 , a ship called the gulfwing reported a barometric pressure of 978 mbar ( 28 @ . @ 88 inhg ) , which confirmed that the storm attained hurricane status . [SEP] after passing north of the turks and caicos islands , the hurricane struck eleuthera and harbour island in the bahamas on september 3 , the latter at 1100 utc . [SEP]
[CLS] a station on the latter island reported a pressure of 27 @ . @ 90 inhg ( 945 mb ) during the 30 minute passage of the eye . [SEP] based on the pressure and the small size of the storm , it is estimated the hurricane struck harbour island with peak winds of 140 mph ( 225 km / h ) , making it the equivalent of a modern category 4 hurricane on the saffir @ - @ simpson scale . [SEP]
[CLS] interpolation suggested that the storm reached major hurricane status , or category 3 status , on september 2 . [SEP] the hurricane initially followed the course of another hurricane that passed through the area in late august , which ultimately struck cuba and texas . [SEP]
[CLS] this hurricane instead maintained a general west @ - @ northwest track . [SEP] after moving through the northern bahamas , the hurricane weakened slightly before making landfall at jupiter , florida , at 0500 utc on september 4 . [SEP]
[CLS] a station there reported a pressure of 27 @ . @ 98 inhg ( 948 mb ) during a 40 minute period of the eye ' s passage ; this suggested a landfall strength of 125 mph ( 201 km / h ) . [SEP] at the time , the radius of maximum winds was 15 mi ( 24 km ) , which was smaller than average . [SEP]
[CLS] after landfall , the hurricane weakened rapidly while crossing the state . [SEP] it briefly emerged into the gulf of mexico as a tropical storm early on september 5 . [SEP]
[CLS] a few hours later while continuing to the northwest , it made another landfall near rosewood — a ghost town in levy county , east of cedar key — with winds of about 65 mph ( 105 km / h ) . [SEP] turning to the north , the storm slowly weakened as it crossed into georgia , dissipating on september 7 near augusta . [SEP]
[CLS] on september 2 , a fleet of eight aircraft evacuated all white residents from west end , grand bahama , to daytona beach , florida . [SEP] while the storm was near peak intensity on september 3 , the weather bureau issued hurricane warnings from miami to melbourne , florida , with storm warnings extending northward to jacksonville . [SEP]
[CLS] later that day , storm warnings , were issued from key west to cedar key . [SEP] about 2 @ , @ 500 people evacuated by train from areas around lake okeechobee . [SEP]
[CLS] by evening on september 3 , high tides sent sea spray over coastal seawalls in palm beach county as residents boarded up buildings ; structures on clematis street in west palm beach were said to be a " solid front " of plywood . [SEP] along the coast , observers reported very rough seas as the eye neared land . [SEP]
[CLS] the powerful hurricane moved over or near several islands in the bahamas . [SEP] winds on spanish wells and harbour island were both estimated at around 140 mph ( 225 km / h ) . [SEP]
[CLS] winds reached 110 mph ( 177 km / h ) at governor ' s harbour , 100 mph ( 161 km / h ) on eleuthera , and 120 mph ( 193 km / h ) on the abaco islands . [SEP] the storm was farther away from nassau , where winds reached 61 mph ( 98 km / h ) . [SEP]
[CLS] the hurricane damaged a lumber mill on abaco , washing away a dock . [SEP] heavy damage occurred on harbour island , including to several roofs , the walls of government buildings , and the water system . [SEP]
[CLS] the hurricane destroyed four churches and 37 houses , leaving 100 people homeless . [SEP] a 1 @ . @ 5 mi ( 2 @ . @ 4 km ) road on eleuthera was destroyed . [SEP]
[CLS] several islands sustained damage to farms , including the total loss of various fruit trees on russell island . [SEP] despite category 4 winds on spanish wells , only five houses were destroyed , although most of the remaining dwellings lost their roofs . [SEP]
[CLS] collectively between north point , james cistern , and gregory town on eleuthera , the storm destroyed 55 houses and damaged many others . [SEP] on grand bahama , where a 9 to 12 ft ( 2 @ . @ 7 to 3 @ . @ 7 m ) storm surge was reported , half of the houses were destroyed , as were 13 boats and two planes , and most docks were wrecked . [SEP]
[CLS] when the storm moved ashore in florida , winds reached an estimated 125 mph ( 201 km / h ) in jupiter ; these occurred after the eye passed . [CLS] the storm produced the strongest winds in the city since the 1928 okeechobee hurricane . [SEP] winds were not as strong farther from the center ; 40 to 45 mph ( 64 to 72 km / h ) winds were observed in miami to the south , titusville to the north , and tampa on the west coast . [SEP]
[CLS] fort pierce estimated peak winds of 80 to 90 mph ( 129 to 145 km / h ) , and pressures dipped to 29 @ . @ 14 inhg ( 987 mb ) . [SEP] inland , winds near lake okeechobee peaked at only 60 mph ( 97 km / h ) . [SEP]
[CLS] the hurricane dropped heavy rainfall along its path , peaking at 17 @ . @ 8 in ( 450 mm ) in clermont . [SEP] at west palm beach , the majority of the damage was confined to vegetation . [SEP]
[CLS] several coconut and royal palms that withstood the 1928 hurricane snapped , littering streets with broken trunks . [SEP] winds downed road signs on many streets , and floodwaters covered the greens on a local golf course . [SEP]
[CLS] some garages and isolated structures , mostly lightweight , were partly or totally destroyed , along with a lumber warehouse . [SEP] some homes that lost roofing shingles had water damage to their interiors as well . [SEP]
[CLS] nearby lake worth sustained extensive breakage of windows , including plate glass , and loss of tile and shingle roofing , but preparations reduced losses to just several thousand dollars , and no post @ - @ storm accidents took place . [SEP] strong winds snapped many light poles in the city , and trees and shrubs were broken or uprooted . [SEP]
[CLS] as in lake worth , officials in west palm beach credited preparations and stringent building codes with reducing overall damage . [SEP] the city had learned from previous experience with severe storms in 1926 , 1928 , and 1929 . [SEP]
[CLS] high tides eroded ocean boulevard at several spots and disrupted access to several bridges on the lake worth lagoon . [SEP] winter estates and hotels on palm beach generally sustained little material damage , except to vegetation , and county properties went largely unscathed . [SEP]
[CLS] in martin and st . lucie counties , the storm was considered among the worst on record . [SEP] the storm leveled some homes and swept many others off their foundations . [SEP]
[CLS] at stuart , winds removed or badly damaged 75 % of the roofs in town . [SEP] the storm destroyed the third floor of the building that housed a bowling alley and the stuart news , a local newspaper . [SEP]
[CLS] at olympia , an abandoned settlement also known as olympia beach , strong winds leveled the old olympia inn , a gas station , and the second floor of a pharmaceutical building . [SEP] winds also tore the roof off an ice plant . [SEP]
[CLS] a bridge leading to the barrier island from olympia was partly wrecked ; the bridge tender survived by gripping the railing during the storm . [SEP] winds leveled his nearby home . [SEP]
[CLS] according to the monthly weather review , some of the most severe damage from the storm in florida was at olympia . [SEP] the storm left many homes in hobe sound uninhabitable , forcing crews to tear them down . [SEP]
[CLS] winter estates on the island , however , were better built and little damaged . [SEP] while stuart and hobe sound sustained significant damage , port salerno suffered minimally . [SEP]
[CLS] in stuart , the storm left 400 to 500 people homeless , up to nearly 10 % of the population , which was 5 @ , @ 100 at the time . [SEP] between jupiter and fort pierce , the storm knocked down power and telegraph lines . [SEP]
[CLS] in the latter city , high waves washed out a portion of the causeway . [SEP] in the 1980s , an elderly resident recalled that the storm was the most severe on record in fort pierce . [SEP]
[CLS] crop damage was worst along the indian river lagoon ; several farms in stuart experienced total losses , and statewide , 16 % of the citrus crop , or 4 million boxes , were destroyed . [SEP] many chicken coops in stuart were destroyed , and the local chicken population was scattered and dispersed as far as indiantown . [SEP]
[CLS] across southeastern florida , the hurricane damaged 6 @ , @ 465 houses and destroyed another 383 , causing over $ 3 million in damage . [SEP] one person , an african american farm worker , was killed when his shack blew down in gomez , a brakeman died after seven railcars derailed , and a child was killed by airborne debris . [SEP]
[CLS] high rainfall caused flooding across florida , notably near tampa where waters reached 9 ft ( 2 @ . @ 7 m ) deep . [SEP] high rainfall of over 7 in ( 180 mm ) caused a dam operated by tampa electric co . to break 3 mi ( 4 @ . @ 8 km ) northeast of tampa along the hillsborough river . [SEP]
[CLS] the break resulted in severe local damage , flooding portions of sulphur springs . [SEP] workers attempted to save the dam with sandbags , and after the break , most residents in the area were warned of the approaching flood . [SEP]
[CLS] over 50 homes were flooded , forcing about 150 people to evacuate . [SEP] outside florida , the storm produced winds of 48 and 51 mph ( 78 and 81 km / h ) in savannah , georgia and charleston , south carolina , respectively . [SEP]
[CLS] in the latter city , the storm spawned a tornado , which caused about $ 10 @ , @ 000 in property damage . [SEP] heavy rainfall occurred along the georgia and south carolina coasts , reaching over 12 in ( 300 mm ) . [SEP]
[CLS] light rainfall also extended into north carolina . [SEP] in the bahamas after the storm , a boat sailed from nassau to deliver food and building materials to eleuthera . [SEP]
[CLS] after the storm , the national guard offered shelters for at least 400 homeless residents in stuart . [SEP] of the 7 @ , @ 900 families adversely affected by the hurricane , 4 @ , @ 325 required assistance from the american red cross . [SEP]
[CLS] farmers in texas , also affected by a major hurricane , requested growers in florida wait 15 days so they could sell their citrus crop that fell . [SEP] the damaged dam near tampa initially resulted in waters from the hillsborough river being pumped into the city ' s water treatment plant , and a new dam was eventually built in 1944 . [SEP]
[CLS] the second battle of naktong bulge was an engagement between united nations ( un ) and north korean ( nk ) forces early in the korean war from september 1 to september 15 , 1950 , along the naktong river in south korea . [SEP] it was a part of the battle of pusan perimeter , and was one of several large engagements fought simultaneously . [SEP]
[CLS] the battle ended in a victory for the united nations after large numbers of united states ( us ) and republic of korea ( rok ) troops repelled a strong north korean attack . [SEP] after the first battle of naktong bulge , the us army ' s 2nd infantry division was moved to defend the naktong river line . [SEP]
[CLS] the division , which was untried in combat , was struck with a strong attack by several divisions of the korean people ' s army which crossed the river and struck all along the division ' s line . [SEP] the force of the attack split the us 2nd infantry division in half , and the north koreans were able to penetrate to yongsan , promoting a fight there . [SEP]
[CLS] the urgency of the threat to pusan perimeter prompted the us marine corps 1st [SEP] provisional marine brigade to be brought in to reinforce the us army troops . [SEP]
[CLS] in two weeks of heavy fighting , the us forces were able to force the north koreans out of the naktong bulge region . [SEP] the north koreans were further repulsed after the un counterattack at inchon , which culminated in the virtual destruction of the north korean army . [SEP]
[CLS] from the outbreak of the korean war and the invasion of south korea by the north , the north korean people ' s army had enjoyed superiority in both manpower and equipment over both the republic of korea army and the united nations forces dispatched to south korea to prevent it from collapsing . [SEP] the north korean strategy was to aggressively pursue un and rok forces on all avenues of approach south and to engage them aggressively , attacking from the front and initiating a double envelopment of both flanks of the unit , which allowed the north koreans to surround and cut off the opposing force , which would then be forced to retreat in disarray , often leaving behind much of its equipment . [SEP]
[CLS] from their initial june 25 offensive to fights in july and early august , the north koreans used this strategy to effectively defeat any un force and push it south . [SEP] however , when the un forces , under the eighth united states army , established the pusan perimeter in august , the un troops held a continuous line along the peninsula which north korean troops could not flank , and their advantages in numbers decreased daily as the superior un logistical system brought in more troops and supplies to the un army . [SEP]
[CLS] when the north koreans approached the pusan perimeter on august 5 , they attempted the same frontal assault technique on the four main avenues of approach into the perimeter . [SEP] throughout august , the nk 6th division , and later the nk 7th division engaged the us 25th infantry division at the battle of masan , initially repelling a un counteroffensive before countering with battles at komam @ - @ ni and battle mountain . [SEP]
[CLS] these attacks stalled as un forces , well equipped and with plenty of reserves , repeatedly repelled north korean attacks . [SEP] north of masan , the nk 4th division and the us 24th infantry division sparred in the naktong bulge area . [SEP]
[CLS] in the first battle of naktong bulge , the north korean division was unable to hold its bridgehead across the river as large numbers of us reserve forces were brought in to repel it , and on august 19 , the nk 4th division was forced back across the river with 50 percent casualties . [SEP] in the taegu region , five north korean divisions were repulsed by three un divisions in several attempts to attack the city during the battle of taegu . [SEP]
[CLS] particularly heavy fighting took place at the battle of the bowling alley where the nk 13th division was almost completely destroyed in the attack . [SEP] on the east coast , three more north korean divisions were repulsed by the south koreans at p ' ohang @ - @ dong during the battle of p ' ohang @ - @ dong . [SEP]
[CLS] all along the front , the north korean troops were reeling from these defeats , the first time in the war their strategies were not working . [SEP] in planning its new offensive , the north korean command decided any attempt to flank the un force was impossible thanks to the support of the un navy . [SEP]
[CLS] instead , they opted to use frontal attack to breach the perimeter and collapse it as the only hope of achieving success in the battle . [SEP] fed by intelligence from the soviet union the north koreans were aware the un forces were building up along the pusan perimeter and that it must conduct an offensive soon or it could not win the battle . [SEP]
[CLS] a secondary objective was to surround taegu and destroy the un and rok units in that city . [SEP] as part of this mission , the north korean units would first cut the supply lines to taegu . [SEP]
[CLS] on august 20 , the north korean commands distributed operations orders to their subordinate units . [SEP] the north koreans called for a simultaneous five @ - @ prong attack against the un lines . [SEP]
[CLS] these attacks would overwhelm the un defenders and allow the north koreans to break through the lines in at least one place to force the un forces back . [SEP] five battle groupings were ordered . [SEP]
[CLS] the center attack called for the nk 9th division , nk 4th division , nk 2nd division , and nk 10th division break through the us 2nd infantry division at the naktong bulge to miryang and yongsan . [SEP] during the north koreans ' september 1 offensive , the us 25th infantry division ' s us 35th infantry regiment was heavily engaged in the battle of nam river north of masan . [SEP]
[CLS] on the 35th regiment ' s right flank , just north of the confluence of the nam river and the naktong river , was the us 9th infantry regiment , us 2nd infantry division . [SEP] there , in the southernmost part of the 2nd infantry division zone , the 9th infantry regiment held a sector more than 20 @ , @ 000 yards ( 18 @ , @ 000 m ) long , including the bulge area of the naktong where the first battle of naktong bulge had taken place earlier in august . [SEP]
[CLS] each us infantry company on the river line here had a front of 3 @ , @ 000 feet ( 910 m ) to 4 @ , @ 000 feet ( 1 @ , @ 200 m ) and they held only key hills and observation points , as the units were extremely spread out along the wide front . [SEP] during the last week of august , us troops on these hills could see minor north korean activity across the river , which they thought was north koreans organizing the high ground on the west side of the naktong against a possible american attack . [SEP]
[CLS] there were occasional attacks on the 9th infantry ' s forward positions , but to the men in the front lines this appeared to be only a standard patrol action . [SEP] on august 31 , the un forces were alerted to a pending attack when much of the korean civilian labor force fled the front lines . [SEP]
[CLS] intelligence officers reported an attack was coming . [SEP] on the west side of the naktong , north korean major general pak kyo sam , commanding the nk 9th division , issued his operations order to the division on august 28 . [SEP]
[CLS] its mission in the forthcoming attack was to outflank and destroy the us troops at naktong bulge by capturing the miryang and samnangjin areas to cut off the us 2nd division ' s route of supply and withdrawal between taegu and pusan . [SEP] however , the north koreans weren ' t aware that the us 2nd infantry division had recently replaced the us 24th infantry division in positions along the naktong river . [SEP]
[CLS] consequently , they expected lighter resistance ; the 24th troops were exhausted from months of fighting but the 2nd division men were fresh and newly arrived in korea . [SEP] they had only recently been moved into the line . [SEP]
[CLS] the north koreans began crossing the naktong river under cover of darkness at certain points . [SEP] on the southern @ - @ most flank of the 9th infantry river line , just above the junction of the nam river with the naktong , a company of the 1st battalion was dug in on a long finger ridge paralleling the naktong that terminates in hill 94 at the kihang ferry site . [SEP]
[CLS] the river road from namji @ - @ ri running west along the naktong passes the southern tip of this ridge and crosses to the west side of the river at the ferry . [SEP] a small village called agok lay at the base of hill 94 and 300 yards ( 270 m ) from the river . [SEP]
[CLS] a patrol of tanks and armored vehicles , together with two infantry squads of a company , 9th infantry , held a roadblock near the ferry and close to agok . [SEP] on the evening of august 31 , a company moved from its ridge positions overlooking agok and the river to new positions along the river below the ridge line . [SEP]
[CLS] that evening sergeant ernest r . kouma led the patrol of two m26 pershing tanks and two m19 gun motor carriages in agok . [SEP] kouma placed his patrol on the west side of agok near the kihang ferry . [SEP]

[CLS] at 22 : 30 the fog lifted and kouma saw that a north korean pontoon bridge was being laid across the river directly in front of his position . [SEP] kouma ' s four vehicles attacked this structure , and after about a minute of heavy fire the bridge collapsed , and the ponton boats used to hold the bridge in place were sunk . [SEP]

[SEP] this gunfire had lasted only two or three minutes when the a company roadblock squads near the tanks received word by field telephone that the company was withdrawing to the original ridge positions and that they should do likewise . [CLS] kouma ' s patrol was then ambushed by a group of north koreans dressed in us military uniforms . [SEP] kouma was wounded and the other three vehicles had to withdraw , but he held the agok site until 07 : 30 the next morning with his single tank . [SEP]

[SEP] the 9th infantry regiment had planned task force manchu on orders from the 2nd division commander major general laurence b . keiser , which in turn had received instructions from eighth united states army commander lieutenant general walton walker for aggressive patrolling . [CLS] at 09 : 35 september 2 , while the north koreans were attempting to destroy the engineer troops at the southern edge of yongsan and clear the road to miryang , walker spoke by telephone with major general doyle o . hickey , deputy chief of staff , far east command in tokyo . [SEP] he described the situation around the perimeter and said the most serious threat was along the boundary between the us 2nd and us 25th infantry divisions . [SEP]

[SEP] he said he had started the 1st provisional marine brigade toward yongsan but had not yet released them for commitment there and he wanted to be sure that general of the army douglas macarthur approved his use of them , since he knew that this would interfere with other plans of the far east command . [CLS] of all the north korean attacks along the pusan perimeter , the second battle of naktong bulge is seen by historians as the most serious threat . [SEP] it was the battle in which the north koreans made the most substantial gains , splitting the us 2nd infantry division in half and briefly capturing yongsan , where they were very close to breaching through to the us forces ' supply lines and threatening other divisions ' rear areas . [CLS] however , once again the fatal weakness of the north korean army had cost it victory after an impressive initial success — its communications and supply were not capable of exploiting a breakthrough and of supporting a continuing attack in the face of massive air , armor , and artillery fire that could be concentrated against its troops at critical points . [SEP] by september 8 , the north korean attacks in the area had been repulsed . [SEP]
[CLS] hed pe , also known as ( hed ) planet earth and stylized as ( həd ) p . e . , is an american rock band from huntington beach , california . [SEP] formed in 1994 , the band performs a style of music which it refers to as " g @ - @ punk " , a fusion of punk rock and gangsta rap . [SEP]
[CLS] after releasing three albums on jive records , hed pe left the label to record independently , eventually signing with suburban noize records in 2006 . [SEP] since 2006 , the band has become known for its involvement in the 9 / 11 truth movement , referencing it in many of their song lyrics and concerts , as well as the concept of the album new world orphans . [SEP]
[CLS] to date , they have released nine studio albums , one live album and two compilation albums . [SEP] the band was formed by vocalist jared gomes , formerly of the clue , also known as " m . c . u . d . " ( mc underdog ) , and guitarist wes geer , who became friends amidst the orange county hardcore punk scene . [SEP]
[CLS] gomes and geer recruited guitarist chizad , bassist mawk , [SEP] drummer b . c . vaught and dj product © 1969 . [SEP]
[CLS] they named the group " hed " , which stands for " higher education " . [SEP] the band built a following with their energetic performances at local venues , and released the self @ - @ financed extended play , church of realities . [SEP]
[CLS] legal issues forced hed to change their name , adding " pe " , which stood for " planet earth " . [SEP] hed pe signed with jive records , releasing their self @ - @ titled debut album in 1997 . [SEP]
[CLS] in his review of the album , allmusic ' s steve huey wrote " there are some slow and / or unfocused moments [ . . . ] but overall , its aggression will probably play well with late - ' 90s metal and punk fans . " [SEP] due to the label ' s contractual terms and the disappointing sales of the album , the band found themselves unable to repay the cash advances given to them by jive . [SEP]

[CLS] it peaked at no . 16 on the independent albums chart , and at no . 138 on the billboard 200 . [CLS] hed pe released their first live album , the d . i . y . guys , in 2008 . [SEP] on january 13 , 2009 , they released their seventh studio album , new world orphans . [SEP]
[CLS] it was released in three different versions ; each contains a different set of bonus tracks . [SEP] in 2009 , drummer trauma joined the band . [SEP]

[CLS] towards the end of 2013 , dj product mysteriously left the band with no explanation and no comment from the other members . [CLS] on may 13 , 2014 , on the band ' s official facebook page , they released the official announcement of when the band ' s new album evolution will hit stores . [SEP] the album is set for release july 22 , 2014 . [SEP]
[CLS] they also released a teaser of the tone of the new album on their facebook page and soon after , the track " one more body " . [SEP] in 2015 , it was confirmed that 12 @ - @ year guitarist jaxon benge and original bassist mark young had left the band . [SEP]
[CLS] they were replaced by guitarist greg " gregzilla " harrison and bassist kurt blankenship , leaving vocalist and founding member jared gomes as the group ' s only remaining original talent . [SEP] hed pe performs a style of music which they have referred to as " g @ - @ punk " , a phrase inspired by the term " g @ - @ funk " , itself a reference to the p @ - @ funk collective . [SEP]
[CLS] hed pe ' s music is a fusion of styles ranging from hip hop , reggae , and ska to hard rock , punk , and heavy metal . [SEP] other elements that have been incorporated into this style include blues , funk , jazz and industrial . [SEP]
[CLS] jared gomes ' vocal style ranges from melodic singing to rapping , screaming , and death growls . [SEP] the band ' s lyrics draw from a number of subjects , including the existence of extraterrestrial life , criticism of organized religion , the 9 / 11 truth movement , cannabis use and sexual intercourse . [SEP]
[CLS] gomes , in addition to the 9 / 11 truth movement , has expressed support for social liberal politicians such as nancy pelosi and president barack obama . [SEP] previously however , gomes ' 2004 lyrics for only in amerika expressed support for nationalism , and called for retaliation against al qaeda for the 9 / 11 terrorist attacks . [SEP]
[CLS] the band ' s influences include hem , beastie boys , black sabbath , bob marley , led zeppelin , nine inch nails , snoop dogg , cypress hill , notorious b . i . g . and rage against the machine .
