[CLS] the presented plots of image impedance , attenuation and phase change correspond to a low @ - @ pass prototype filter section . [SEP] the prototype has a cut @ - @ off frequency of ωc 1 ω . [SEP]
[CLS] this is produced by a filter half @ - @ section with inductance l 1 farad . [SEP] this prototype can be impedance scaled and frequency scaled to the desired values . [SEP]
[CLS] the low @ - @ pass prototype can also be transformed into high @ - @ pass , band @ - @ pass or band @ - @ stop types by application of suitable frequency transformations . [SEP] several l @ - @ shape half @ - @ sections may be cascaded to form a composite filter . [SEP]
[CLS] like impedance must always face like in these combinations . [SEP] there are therefore two circuits that can be formed with two identical l @ - @ shaped half @ - @ sections . [SEP]
[CLS] where a port of image impedance zit faces another zit , the section is called a π section . [SEP] where ziπ faces ziπ the section so formed is a t section . [SEP]
[CLS] further additions of half @ - @ sections to either of these section forms a ladder network which may start and end with series or shunt elements . [SEP] it should be borne in mind that the characteristics of the filter predicted by the image method are only accurate if the section is terminated with its image impedance . [SEP]
[CLS] this is usually not true of the sections at either end , which are usually terminated with a fixed resistance . [SEP] the further the section is from the end of the filter , the more accurate the prediction will become , since the effects of the terminating impedances are masked by the intervening sections . [SEP]
[CLS] " the snowmen " is an episode of the british science fiction television series doctor who , first broadcast on christmas day 2012 on bbc one . [SEP] it is the eighth christmas special since the show ' s 2005 revival and the first to be within a series . [SEP]
[CLS] it was written by head writer and executive producer steven moffat and directed by saul metzstein . [SEP] the episode is set in the victorian era and sees the doctor ( matt smith ) brooding with the assistance of silurian madame vastra ( neve mcintosh ) , her wife jenny flint ( catrin stewart ) and sontaran strax ( dan starkey ) , after the loss of companions amy pond and rory williams in the previous episode , " the angels take manhattan " . [SEP]
[CLS] he is forced out of hiding to investigate mysterious , sentient snowmen that are building themselves and meets clara oswald ( jenna @ - @ louise coleman ) , a governess also investigating the snowmen . [SEP] they discover that the snowmen are being animated by the great intelligence ( voice of ian mckellen ) with the help of a man named dr simeon ( richard e . grant ) . [SEP]
[CLS] building upon the character ' s surprise introduction in " asylum of the daleks " , " the snowmen " introduces clara as the doctor ' s new companion , though ultimately it would be a third version of her character that would travel with the doctor starting with " the bells of saint john " . [SEP] in addition to clara , " the snowmen " also introduces a redesigned tardis , revised title sequence and theme music , and sees changes to the doctor ' s costume . [SEP]
[CLS] the special was produced in august 2012 , with location filming in newport , wales and bristol . [SEP] it received final ratings of 9 @ . @ 87 million viewers in the uk , becoming the fourth most @ - @ watched programme of christmas day . " [SEP]
[CLS] the snowmen " was met with mostly positive reviews from critics , most of whom received the introduction and character of clara well . [SEP] however , some felt that grant and mckellen were underused as villains or the plot was slight because of the focus on characterisation . [SEP]
[CLS] to promote the special , three prequels were released . [SEP] the first was broadcast during the 2012 children in need telethon on 16 november 2012 , titled " the great detective " . [SEP]
[CLS] the silurian madame vastra , her human wife jenny flint , and the sontaran strax ( all returning from " a good man goes to war " ) [SEP] describe a number of strange phenomena to a shadowed fourth detective . [SEP]
[CLS] the fourth detective reveals himself to be the doctor , and tells the group that he has retired . [SEP] a second prequel , titled " vastra investigates " , was released online on 17 december 2012 . [SEP]
[CLS] at the end of a case , vastra and jenny converse with an officer from scotland yard and apologise for strax ' s violent wishes for the culprit ' s punishment . [SEP] vastra explains strax ' s alien origin as well as her own to the officer , much to his astonishment . [SEP]
[CLS] vastra reveals that she was awoken by an extension to the london underground and initially disliked humans , though that changed when she fell in love with jenny . [SEP] on the carriage ride home , jenny notices it is beginning to snow and vastra notes that the snow should be impossible because there are no clouds in the sky . [SEP]
[CLS] a third prequel , titled " the battle of demon ' s run — two days later " was released on the united states itunes and amazon video stores on 25 march 2013 . [SEP] two days after the events of " a good man goes to war " , vastra and jenny convince strax that he is not mortally wounded and invite him to accompany them back to 1800s london . [SEP]
[CLS] the scene had been filmed as an extra due to the anticipation that fans would ask how strax was resurrected and came to be in vastra ' s employ . [SEP] in 1842 england , a young boy builds a snowman , but refuses to play with the other children . [SEP]
[CLS] the snowman starts speaking to the boy , repeating his assertions that the other children are silly . [SEP] fifty years later , the boy has grown up to be dr . walter simeon , proprietor of the great intelligence institute . [SEP]
[CLS] he hires men to collect samples of snow , which he places in a large snow @ - @ filled globe in his laboratory before feeding the men to a group of animated snowmen . [SEP] the doctor , still despondent after losing his former companions amy pond and rory williams , has parked his tardis above victorian london among the clouds . [SEP]
[CLS] he uses his allies vastra , jenny , and strax to keep people away from him . [SEP] they also fill their time investigating mysteries throughout the city . [SEP]
[CLS] elsewhere , barmaid clara oswin oswald investigates a disturbance outside the tavern she works at and finds the doctor walking by . [SEP] he attempts to leave discreetly , but clara follows him to a coach . [SEP]
[CLS] not wishing to become involved in matters , the doctor instructs strax to bring him a memory worm that will erase the last hour of clara ' s memories with just a touch . [SEP] before they can do so , they are surrounded by snowmen created from snow with psychic properties who attack the group . [SEP]
[CLS] the doctor realises that clara ' s thoughts are creating the snowmen and ends the threat by instructing her to think of them melting . [SEP] clara cautions the doctor that if he wipes her memory , she will forget how to deal with the snowmen . [SEP]
[CLS] the doctor reluctantly allows her to go and ascends a staircase to the sky to return to the tardis . [SEP] clara follows him and knocks on the door , but she hides and flees down the staircase when the doctor answers . [SEP]
[CLS] clara returns to her other job as governess for the children of captain latimer . [SEP] she learns that latimer ' s daughter has been having horrible dreams about their previous governess returning from the dead . [SEP]
[CLS] clara realises that the pond that contains the old governess ' body is the only thing still frozen around them . [SEP] she attempts to track down the doctor but instead attracts the attention of jenny , who takes her to see vastra . [SEP]
[CLS] vastra tells clara she gets only one word to impress the doctor with if she wants his help . [SEP] clara chooses the word " pond " , which shocks the doctor and arouses his interest . [SEP]
[CLS] acting on a tip from strax , the doctor visits the great intelligence institute posing as sherlock holmes . [SEP] he confronts dr . simeon and find a large glass globe in simeon ' s office that contains psychic snow . [SEP]
[CLS] the doctor speaks to the great intelligence , the entity that has been speaking to dr . simeon since he was a boy . [SEP] he learns that the great intelligence has been controlling the snowmen and has taken interest in latimer ' s pond . [SEP]
[CLS] the doctor visits the pond and deduces that the great intelligence is using the old governess ' body as a dna blueprint to form an ice creature that will retain its form and not melt . [SEP] while clara is putting the children to bed , the frozen body of the governess breaks into the house . [SEP]
[CLS] the doctor fights her off and is joined by vastra , jenny and strax . [SEP] dr . simeon arrives with more snowmen and tells them he wants the governess ' ice body . [SEP]
[CLS] the doctor flees with clara to the roof of the mansion and then to the tardis hovering overhead . [SEP] they are pursued by the ice governess , whom the doctor traps under a layer of frozen ice crystals . [SEP]
[CLS] inside the tardis the doctor gives clara a tardis key , but the ice governess arrives and pulls clara down off the cloud . [SEP] the doctor picks up clara and takes her back to latimer ' s mansion , placing her under medical care of strax . [SEP]
[CLS] he collects the ice fragments from the governess and places them in a souvenir london underground biscuit tin . [SEP] he and vastra travel to simeon ' s lab , where the doctor notes the intelligence ' s plan to replace humanity with ice creatures and holds up the tin with the necessary dna . [SEP]
[CLS] dr simeon grabs the tin and opens it only to find the memory worm , which latches on to him . [SEP] the doctor states that the great intelligence , which has been existing as a mirror of dr simeon ' s thoughts , will vanish with the erasure of simeon ' s memories . [SEP]
[CLS] instead , the intelligence reveals that it existed long enough that it can now control simeon ' s body , which it uses to attack vastra and the doctor . [SEP] the influence of the great intelligence quickly wanes , and simeon falls dead . [SEP]
[CLS] outside , a salt @ - @ water rain has started , and the doctor sees that another psychic ability has taken control of the snow from the great intelligence : the latimer family , crying for clara . [SEP] strax informs the doctor upon his return to the latimer mansion that clara only has moments left , and she passes away as the doctor returns the tardis key to her . [SEP]
[CLS] at her funeral , the doctor reads clara ' s full name on her tombstone and realises she is the woman he met in " asylum of the daleks " who became a dalek , whom he refers to as " souffle girl " . [SEP] he gleefully announces that a person dying twice is an impossibility and , bidding farewell to his allies for now , the doctor departs in the tardis to investigate and find clara . [SEP]
[CLS] the episode concludes in contemporary times , where a young woman resembling clara walks through the same graveyard , pausing by clara ' s tombstone . [SEP] the second doctor previously encountered the great intelligence in the serials the abominable snowmen ( 1967 ) , set in the 1930s , and the web of fear ( 1968 ) , set in the 1960s . [SEP]
[CLS] in these stories , the great intelligence uses robot yeti as its physical presence . [SEP] the events of the web of fear are alluded to by the doctor in " the snowmen " when he presents the london underground biscuit tin to the great intelligence in dr simeon ' s laboratory ; the intelligence states , " i do not understand these markings " , in reference to the 1967 london underground map design on the tin . [SEP]
[CLS] the doctor remarks that the underground is a " key strategic weakness in metropolitan living " , referring to ( and possibly setting in motion ) the future yeti attack on london via the underground . [SEP] coleman previously played oswin oswald in " asylum of the daleks " , though the connection between the two characters is not clarified until clara reveals she has an interest in souffles , a trait that oswin ' s character also had . [SEP]
[CLS] the doctor , after meeting clara , wistfully replies " those were the days " when she asks why he isn ' t staying to get acquainted with her , which are the same words he tells craig owens ( " closing time " ) when craig comments that the doctor always wins . [SEP] the final scenes at the graveyard establish that clara shares the same name as oswin , leading the doctor to surmise they are the same person . [SEP]
[CLS] as seen on her gravestone , clara ' s birthdate is 23 november , the date doctor who was first transmitted in 1963 . [SEP] writer steven moffat stated that he wanted an " epic " quality to the christmas special . [SEP]
[CLS] the story would also show how the doctor had responded to losing his previous companions ; moffat said that " i think he ' s probably reached the point in his life where he ' s saying , ' friendship for me is just postponed bereavement — i want to be on my own for a while ' . " [SEP] moffat compared the withdrawn doctor seen at the onset of the episode to the first appearances of the first doctor ( william hartnell ) in 1963 and the ninth doctor ( christopher eccleston ) in 2005 . [SEP]
[CLS] he also attributed the idea of a retired doctor to a plot proposed by douglas adams in the 1970s , but rejected by the production team at the time . [SEP] continuing the theme introduced with the series ' first five episodes , " the snowmen " was promoted like a movie . [SEP]
[CLS] a movie poster was released in the radio times , showing the doctor and clara ascending the ladder to the tardis . [SEP] the episode saw several major design changes for the series . " [SEP]
[CLS] the snowmen " is the debut of a redesigned tardis interior , as well as a new title sequence and variation of the theme tune . [SEP] the new title sequence features a brief glimpse of the doctor ' s face , the first time since survival , the final serial of the classic series in 1989 , that the doctor ' s face has been seen in the title sequence . [SEP]
[CLS] moffat had noticed that the tardis ' design was getting " progressively whimsical " and resembled more of a " magical place " rather than a machine . [SEP] it was designed by series production designer michael pickwood , who stated that the new interior was also supposed to be " darker and moodier " and provide an easier access to the " gallery " of the ship when shooting . [SEP]
[CLS] the doctor also wears a one @ - @ off costume , victorian @ - @ themed , which smith described as " a bit artful dodger meets the doctor " . [SEP] moffat described the new outfit as a " progression " as the doctor was in " a different phase of his life now " and felt more " grown @ - @ up " and fatherlike . [SEP]
[CLS] the costume was designed by howard burden for this episode . " [SEP] the snowmen " also contains several references to sherlock holmes , including the doctor dressing up as him . [SEP]
[CLS] moffat is co @ - @ creator of the bbc series sherlock , for which smith auditioned for the role of doctor watson before being cast as the doctor . [SEP] in addition , the incidental music during the scene bears a resemblance to the sherlock theme . [SEP]
[CLS] this episode marks the return of jenna @ - @ louise coleman , who previously appeared in the series opener , " asylum of the daleks " . [SEP] coleman was cast because of her chemistry with matt smith , and especially because she was able to talk faster than him . [SEP]
[CLS] she auditioned for the role of clara , not oswin from " asylum " , as the concept of the two characters being the same only occurred to moffat whilst casting for clara . [SEP] the production team requested that the press and fans who attended advanced screenings keep coleman ' s appearance a secret until " asylum " was broadcast ; the effort was ultimately successful . [SEP]
[CLS] moffat stated that the introduction of a new companion made " the show feel different " and brought the story to " a new beginning " with a different person meeting the doctor . [SEP] smith said that clara was different from her predecessor amy pond ( karen gillan ) , which allowed the audience to see a different side of the doctor . [SEP]
[CLS] coleman described her as resourceful and not intimidated , citing the reason for following the doctor at the beginning as pursuing answers . [SEP] the clara who would become a travelling companion of the doctor would not debut until the spring premiere , " the bells of saint john " ; save for a brief cameo at the end of " the snowmen " . [SEP]
[CLS] coleman stated that she played each version as individuals with " trust that there would be a payoff " to her mystery . [SEP] also returning to the series are neve mcintosh as madame vastra , dan starkey as strax and catrin stewart as jenny . [SEP]
[CLS] all three previously appeared in " a good man goes to war " and reprised their roles both in this episode and in the prequels . [SEP] they returned due to the popularity of vastra and jenny ; moffat considered a spin @ - @ off featuring them , though he did not have the time to do it . [SEP]
[CLS] instead , he decided to bring them back in the main series . [SEP] richard e . grant had previously played the doctor on two occasions , as an alternative tenth doctor in the spoof charity special doctor who and the curse of fatal death , which was written by moffat and as an alternative ninth doctor in the animated story scream of the shalka which had been intended to be a continuation of the series before it was revived in 2005 . [SEP]
[CLS] smith commented that grant was " born to be a who villain . [SEP] he pitches it on that perfect level and tone " . [SEP]
[CLS] grant ' s appearance in doctor who was teased by the bbc via twitter , announcing his appearance at midnight 5 august 2012 . [SEP] tom ward was drawn to his role because of the quality of the script , and also stated his young children were pleased that he appeared in the programme . [SEP]
[CLS] the great intelligence was voiced by sir ian mckellen . [SEP] the two children clara is governess to , digby and francesca , were played by real @ - @ life brother and sister joseph and ellie darcey @ - @ alden . [SEP]
[CLS] " the snowmen " was originally intended to be produced in the fourth production block of the series and be the first episode coleman shot as her character ; however , it did not begin filming until the week of 6 august 2012 , after coleman had worked on later episodes while moffat was writing the christmas special . [SEP] the read @ - @ through had taken place on 2 august 2012 . [SEP]
[CLS] this was the first christmas special to be filmed in bbc wales ' new roath lock studios . [SEP] scenes featuring coleman and several guest stars in a victorian setting were filmed in newport , wales , while coleman and smith were also spotted filming in bristol two weeks later on 21 august . [SEP]
[CLS] some scenes which used snow props were filmed in portland square , bristol , where filming took place overnight on 21 – 22 august 2012 . [SEP] bristol was chosen because it had victorian @ - @ era architecture . [SEP]
[CLS] pickwood stated that his favourite set is the london street with the back of the pub , which he said was based on a sixteenth @ - @ century building in oxford . [SEP] the locations were blocked off and sprayed with fake snow . [SEP]
[CLS] the tardis on the cloud was achieved through a mix of fog on the studio floor and post @ - @ production special effects . [SEP] director saul metzstein explained that it was difficult to achieve the desired look for the snowmen ; the first ones he likened to zippy from rainbow which was too " cute " of an appearance , and so the effects team created more menacing cgi faces . [SEP]
[CLS] clara ' s introduction to the tardis introduced two novel effects for the show . [SEP] the first was a single @ - @ shot camera tracking from a few feet away from the tardis to its interior , with the implication of the tardis ' s trans @ - @ dimensional nature shown to the audience . [SEP]
[CLS] in the following shot , the camera does a complete circle of the tardis console , an effect not seen since the early days of the show . [SEP] metzstein wanted to include this shot to further emphasize the " bigger on the inside than the outside " nature of the time machine . [SEP]
[CLS] in addition to the three prequel mini @ - @ episodes , the cast also filmed an additional promotional video , " songtaran carols , " which the bbc uploaded during the days leading up to the broadcast . [SEP] the video featured starkey singing modified versions of several christmas songs in character as strax as his castmates look on , before everyone breaks character and begins laughing . [SEP]
[CLS] " the snowmen " aired on bbc one on 25 december 2012 at 5 : 15 pm , the same day on bbc america in the us and space in canada and the next day on abc1 in australia and on prime in new zealand . [SEP] uk overnight ratings showed that the special had been watched by 7 @ . @ 6 million viewers , coming in sixth for the night . [SEP]
[CLS] final consolidated figures ( not including bbc iplayer viewers ) showed that the episode was watched by 9 @ . @ 87 million viewers , coming in fourth for the night . [SEP] it also received an appreciation index figure of 87 , higher than most of the doctor who christmas specials . [SEP]
[CLS] the iplayer version had 1 @ , @ 467 @ , @ 220 views , making it the most popular tv show on iplayer over christmas . [SEP] the us airing was seen by 1 @ . @ 43 million viewers , with a 0 @ . @ 6 rating in the demographic of adults aged 18 – 49 . [SEP]
[CLS] the episode received mostly positive reviews . [SEP] dan martin of the guardian called it " actually the best christmas special since ' the christmas invasion ' " and the first to be " actually scary " , with " everything we like " about doctor who and christmas . [SEP]
[CLS] he praised coleman ' s introduction as clara and the gang of vastra , jenny , and strax . [SEP] ign ' s matt risley gave " the snowmen " a score of 9 @ . @ 4 out of 10 , describing it as " a rollicking , riveting masterclass in storytelling " which " refreshingly " lacked traditional christmas references " in favour of some sparkling dialogue , gorgeous set design and fascinating characterisation " . [SEP]
[CLS] while he felt that grant and mckellen were underused , he was very positive towards coleman ' s " unpredictable " clara . [SEP] radio times reviewer patrick mulkern was pleased with the return of the great intelligence despite an inconsistency in the timeline he found , and praised the " lovely images " and direction of the special , though he felt the variation of the theme music " lacks the menace " of the original . [SEP]
[CLS] while he was positive towards clara , he was " unmoved by her death " as it was " plainly silly " that she did not look injured . [SEP] nick setchfield of sfx gave the special four and a half out of five stars , writing that " the power of emotion saves the day again " was appropriate in light of the festivities and many fairytales referenced in the story . [SEP]
[CLS] setchfield was positive towards the " terrific " comedy with strax , coleman and the " surprisingly underused " grant , as well as the new title sequence and tardis . [SEP] while he wrote that the subtle callback of the great intelligence was " a tad more interesting than the usual ' so , we meet again ! ' [SEP]
[CLS] schtick " , he ultimately felt their threat " never quite comes into sharp relief " . [SEP] neela debnath of the independent wrote that " the snowmen " was stronger than the previous year ' s " the doctor , the widow , and the wardrobe " as it was connected to the overall story of the series , but " still has a way to go if it is to live up to ' a christmas carol ' " . [SEP]
[CLS] despite feeling that it was " enjoyable " , she noted that " the story feels truncated and rushed " the mirror ' s jon cooper also praised coleman and the new side of the doctor that was shown , comparing it to rose tyler ( billie piper ) challenging the ninth doctor ( christopher eccleston ) . [SEP] however , he felt the character @ - @ heavy story was to the detriment of the plot , which was " a classic who set @ - @ up that ultimately suffers from a lack of explanation [ and ] more set @ - @ pieces than a coherent whole " . [SEP]
[CLS] he felt that the episode may not have been accessible for casual viewers , but offered much for fans in time for the programme ' s fiftieth anniversary . [SEP] dominic cavendish of the daily telegraph gave " the snowmen " three out of five stars , disappointed that it was not as scary as it had been hyped to be . [SEP]
[CLS] while he was positive towards smith and the tardis on the cloud , he criticised strax and the " sudoku @ - @ like complexity " of the script . [SEP] the episode was nominated for the 2013 hugo award for best dramatic presentation ( short form ) , alongside " asylum of the daleks " and " the angels take manhattan " , but lost to the game of thrones episode " blackwater " .
