[SEP] in the 13th century , manila consisted of a fortified settlement and trading quarter at the shores of the pasig river , on top of previous older towns . [SEP]
[CLS] manila was then settled by the indianized empire of majapahit as referenced in the epic eulogy poem nagarakretagama which inscribed its conquest by maharaja hayam wuruk . [SEP] selurong " षलरोन ग " which is a historical name for the city of manila is listed in canto 14 alongside sulot , which is now sulu , and kalka . [SEP]
[CLS] during the reign of sultan bolkiah from 1485 to 1521 , the bruneian empire invaded , wanting to take advantage of tondo ' s china trade by attacking its environs and establishing " كوتا [UNK] kota saludong " ( the kingdom of maynila ) . [SEP] they ruled under and gave yearly tribute to the sultanate of brunei as its satellite state . [SEP]
[CLS] they established a new dynasty under the local leader who accepted islam and became rajah salalila or tariq sulayman i . [SEP] he also established a trading challenge to the already rich house of lakan dula in tondo . [SEP]
[CLS] islam was further strengthened by the arrival of muslim traders from the arab @ - @ indian area and southeast asia . [SEP] manila was temporarily besieged by the invasion of chinese pirate @ - @ warlord limahong ( 1574 ) but was thwarted by the local inhabitants , before it became the seat of the colonial government of spain . [SEP]
[CLS] on june 24 , 1571 , spanish conquistador miguel lopez de legazpi arrived from new spain ( now mexico ) , and then exercised rule of the spanish city of manila as a territory of new spain with the establishment of a city council in what today is the district of intramuros . [SEP] lopez de legazpi had the local royalty executed or exiled , after the failure of the tondo conspiracy ; a plot wherein an alliance between japanese merchants , luzon ' s huangs with several datus and rajahs plus the bruneian empire would band together to execute the spaniards and their latin @ - @ american mercenaries , and visayan allies . [SEP]
[CLS] at the conclusion of which , the victorious spaniards made manila the capital of the spanish east indies and of the philippines , which the empire would control for the next three centuries , from 1565 to 1898 . [SEP] manila then became famous during the manila @ - @ acapulco galleon trade which lasted for three centuries and brought goods from europe , africa and latin america across the pacific islands to southeast asia ( which was already an entrepot for goods coming from india , indonesia and china ) and trade also flowed vice versa . [SEP]
[CLS] silver that was mined in mexico and peru were exchanged for chinese silk , indian gems , and the spices of the southeast asia , some of which even flowed to europe . [SEP] likewise wines and olives grown from europe and north africa were transshipped via mexico towards manila . [SEP]
[CLS] manila was occupied by british forces for twenty months , from 1762 to 1764 , and used as a base for an unsuccessful attempt to conquer the philippines during the seven years ' war . [SEP] eventually , the british withdrew from manila as per agreements in the 1763 treaty of paris . [SEP]
[CLS] the chinese were punished for supporting the british invasion , and the small fortress @ - @ city of intramuros , mostly populated by europeans and mexicans , kept its cannons pointed at binondo , the world ' s oldest chinatown . [SEP] mexican independence in 1821 necessitated direct rule from spain . [SEP]
[CLS] under direct spanish rule , banking , industry and education flourished more than it had in the previous two centuries . [SEP] the opening of the suez canal in 1869 facilitated direct trade and communications with spain . [SEP]
[CLS] the growing wealth and education attracted indigenous , chinese , indians , latinos , and europeans from the provinces to manila , all of whom elected a nascent filipino citizenship regardless of ethnicity . [SEP] the developments also facilitated the rise of an illustrado class which espoused liberal ideas , the ideological foundations of the philippine revolution which sought independence from spain . [SEP]
[CLS] after the battle of manila ( 1898 ) , spain ceded the surrendered city of manila to the united states . [SEP] the first philippine republic based at nearby bulacan fought against the americans for control of the city of manila . [SEP]
[CLS] the americans defeated the first philippine republic and captured president emilio aguinaldo who announced allegiance to the united states on april 1 , 1901 . [SEP] upon drafting a new charter for manila in june 1901 , the americans made official what had long been tacit : that the city of manila was not intramuros alone but also all its arrabales . [SEP]
[CLS] the new city charter proclaimed that manila was composed of eleven municipal districts — presumably tondo , binondo , santa cruz , sampaloc , san miguel , pandacan , santa ana , paco , malate , ermita and intramuros . [SEP] in addition to these , the church recognized five parishes as manileno — namely , gagalangin , trozo , balic @ - @ balic , santa mesa and singalong . [SEP]
[CLS] later times would add two more : balut and san andres bukid . [SEP] under american control , a new civilian oriented insular government headed by then governor @ - @ general william howard taft invited city planner daniel burnham for the transformation of manila , to adapt the old city to changed times and modern needs . [SEP]
[CLS] the burnham plan included development of the road system , the use of waterways for transportation , and beautification of manila with the improvement of waterfronts , construction of parks , parkways and various building for various activities . [SEP] the latter included a government center occupying all of wallace field , which extends from luneta to the present taft avenue . [SEP]
[CLS] the philippine capitol was to rise at the taft avenue end of the field , facing toward the sea , and would form , with the buildings of different government bureaus and departments , a quadrangle , lagoon in the center , and a monument to jose rizal at its luneta end . [SEP] of burnham ' s proposed government center , only three units — the legislative building and the building of the finance and agricultural departments — were completed when world war ii erupted . [SEP]
[CLS] due to the japanese occupation of the philippines , american soldiers were ordered to withdraw from the city and all military installations were removed on december 24 , 1941 . [SEP] general douglas macarthur declared manila an open city to prevent further death and destruction ; despite this , the japanese warplanes continued to bomb the city . [SEP]
[CLS] manila was occupied by the japanese forces on january 2 , 1942 . [SEP] manila was also the site of the bloodiest battle in the pacific theater during the second world war . [SEP]
[CLS] after falling to the empire of japan on january 2 , 1942 , it was recaptured by joint american and filipino troops from february 3 to march 3 , 1945 . [SEP] some 100 @ , @ 000 civilians were killed in manila in february 1945 . [SEP]
[CLS] it was the second most devastated city in the world after warsaw during the second world war . [SEP] at the end of world war ii , almost all of the structures in the city , particularly intramuros , were destroyed but after the war , reconstruction took place . [SEP]
[CLS] in 1948 , president elpidio quirino moved the seat of government of the philippines to quezon city , a new capital city in the suburbs and fields northeast of manila , created in 1938 by former president manuel l . quezon , which was named after him . [SEP] the move ended any implementation of the burnham plan ' s intent for the government centre to be at luneta . [SEP]
[CLS] with the visayan @ - @ born arsenio lacson as its first elected mayor in 1952 ( all mayors were appointed prior to this ) , manila underwent the golden age , once again earning its status as the " pearl of the orient " , a moniker it earned before the second world war . [SEP] after lacson ' s term in the 1950s , manila was led by antonio villegas for most of the 1960s . [SEP]
[CLS] ramon bagatsing ( an indian @ - @ filipino ) was mayor for nearly the entire 1970s until the 1986 people power revolution . [SEP] mayors lacson , villegas , and bagatsing are often collectively considered as the " big three of manila " less for their rather long tenures as the city ' s chief executive ( continuously for over three decades , from 1952 – 1986 ) , but more for their indelible contribution to the development and progress of the city and their lasting legacy in uplifting the quality of life and welfare of the people of manila . [SEP]
[CLS] during the administration of president ferdinand marcos , the region of the metro manila was created as an integrated unit with the enactment of presidential decree no . 824 on november 7 , 1975 . [SEP] the area encompassed four cities and thirteen adjoining towns , as a separate regional unit of government . [SEP]
[CLS] on the 405th anniversary of the city ' s foundation on june 24 , 1976 , manila was reinstated by marcos as the capital of the philippines for its historical significance as the seat of government since the spanish period . [SEP] presidential decree no . 940 states that manila has always been to the filipino people and in the eyes of the world , the premier city of the philippines being the center of trade , commerce , education and culture . [SEP]
[CLS] during the martial law era , manila became a hot @ - @ bed of resistance activity as youth and student demonstrators repeatedly clashed with the police and military which were subservient to the marcos regime . [SEP] after decades of resistance , the non @ - @ violent people power revolution ( predecessor to the peaceful @ - @ revolutions that toppled the iron @ - @ curtain in europe ) , ousted the authoritarian marcos from power . [SEP]
[CLS] in 1992 , alfredo lim was elected mayor , the first chinese @ - @ filipino to hold the office . [SEP] he was known for his anti @ - @ crime crusades . [SEP]
[CLS] lim was succeeded by lito atienza , who served as his vice @ - @ mayor . [SEP] atienza was known for his campaign ( and city slogan ) " buhayin ang maynila " ( revive manila ) , which saw the establishment of several parks and the repair and rehabilitation of the city ' s deteriorating facilities . [SEP]
[CLS] he was the city ' s mayor for 3 terms ( 9 years ) before being termed out of office . [SEP] alfredo lim once again ran for mayor and defeated atienza ' s son ali in the 2007 city election and immediately reversed all of atienza ' s projects claiming atienza ' s projects made little contribution to the improvements of the city . [SEP]
[CLS] the relationship of both parties turned bitter , with the two pitting again during the 2010 city elections in which lim won against atienza . [SEP] lim was sued by councilor dennis alcoreza on 2008 over human rights , charged with graft over the rehabilitation of public schools , and was heavily criticized for his haphazard resolution of the rizal park hostage taking incident , one of the deadliest hostage crisis in the philippines . [SEP]
[CLS] later on , vice mayor isko moreno and 28 city councilors filed another case against lim in 2012 , stating that lim ' s statement in a meeting were " life @ - @ threatening " to them . [SEP] on the 2013 elections , former president joseph estrada defeated lim in the mayoral race . [SEP]
[CLS] during his term , estrada has paid the city ' s over ₱ 5 billion debts , increase revenues by 2 @ . @ 35 times from ₱ 6 @ . @ 2 billion in 2012 to ₱ 14 @ . @ 6 billion by 2016 , spent from 2013 to 2016 an unprecedented ₱ 6 @ . @ 76 billion for the city ' s infrastructure , built and or renovated seven city public markets , built 22 schools , increased teachers ' incomes , modernized the six city hospitals and bought dialysis machines and magnetic resonance imaging scanners , increased the efficiency of the police force and reduced crime . [SEP] manila has become the most competitive city in the philippines by 2015 , making the city the best place for doing business and for living in . [SEP]
[CLS] despite his achievements and unprecedented feat as the mayor of manila , however , estrada was re @ - @ elected as manila mayor in the 2016 election against lim and amado bagatsing , only winning by an infinitesimal 2 @ , @ 830 votes . [SEP] manila is located on the eastern shores of manila bay , which rests on the western shores of luzon . [SEP]
[CLS] manila lies 800 miles ( 1 @ , @ 300 kilometers ) from mainland asia . [SEP] the pasig river bisects manila . [SEP]
[CLS] almost all of manila sits on top of centuries of prehistoric alluvial deposits built by the waters of the pasig and on some land reclaimed from manila bay . [SEP] manila ' s land has been altered substantially by human intervention , with considerable land reclamation along the waterfronts since the american colonial times . [SEP]
[CLS] some of the natural variations in topography have been evened out due to the urbanization of the city . [SEP] as of 2013 , manila has a total area of 42 @ . @ 88 square kilometres ( 16 @ . @ 56 sq mi ) . [SEP]
[CLS] manila sits astride the pacific typhoon belt and is criss @ - @ crossed by several fault lines . [SEP] this led to manila and its metropolitan region to be ranked as the second riskiest capital ( city ) to live in according to swiss re . [SEP]
[CLS] the seismically active marikina valley fault system poses a threat to manila and the surrounding regions . [SEP] manila has endured several deadly earthquakes , notably in 1645 and in 1677 which destroyed the stone and brick medieval city . [SEP]
[CLS] the earthquake baroque style was used by the colonial architects during the spanish colonial period in order to adapt to the frequent earthquakes . [SEP] under the koppen climate classification system , manila features a tropical savanna climate ( koppen climate classification aw ) . [SEP]
[CLS] together with the rest of the philippines , manila lies entirely within the tropics . [SEP] its proximity to the equator means that the temperature range is very small , rarely going below 20 ° c ( 68 ° f ) or above 38 ° c ( 100 ° f ) . [SEP]
[CLS] temperature extremes have ranged from 14 @ . @ 5 ° c ( 58 @ . @ 1 ° f ) on january 11 , 1914 to 38 @ . @ 6 ° c ( 101 @ . @ 5 ° f ) on may 7 , 1915 . [SEP] humidity levels are usually very high all year round . [SEP]
[CLS] manila has a distinct dry season from december through may , and a relatively lengthy wet season that covers the remaining period with slightly cooler temperatures . [SEP] in the rainy season it rarely rains all day but the rainfall is very heavy during short periods . [SEP]
[CLS] typhoons usually occur from june to september . [SEP] due to industrial waste and automobiles , manila suffers from air pollution , affecting 98 % of the population . [SEP]
[CLS] annually , the air pollution causes more than 4 @ , @ 000 deaths . [SEP] ermita is manila ' s most air polluted district due to open dump sites and industrial waste . [SEP]
[CLS] according to a report in 2003 , the pasig river is one of the most polluted rivers in the world with 150 tons of domestic waste and 75 tons of industrial waste dumped daily . [SEP] annually , manila is hit with 6 to 7 typhoons creating floods . [SEP]
[CLS] in 2009 , typhoon ketsana struck philippines . [SEP] in the aftermath of typhoon ketsana , the lack of infrastructure led to one of the worst floodings in the philippines and creating a significant amount of pollution . [SEP]
[CLS] following the aftermath of typhoon ketsana , the city began to dredge its rivers and improve its drainage network . [SEP] the pasig river rehabilitation commission is in charge of cleaning up the pasig river and tributaries for transportation , recreation and tourism purposes . [SEP]
[CLS] rehabilitation efforts have resulted in the creation of parks along the riverside , along with stricter pollution controls . [SEP] manila has architecturally significant buildings in a wide range of styles spanning distinct historical and cultural periods . [SEP]
[CLS] architectural styles reflect american , spanish , chinese , and malay influences . [SEP] prominet filipino architects such as antonio toledo , felipe roxas , juan m . arellano and tomas mapua have designed significant buildings in manila such as churches , government offices , theaters , mansions , schools and universities . [SEP]
[CLS] manila is known for its distinct art deco theaters which are designed by national artists such as juan nakpil and pablo antonio . [SEP] the historic escolta street in binondo features many buildings of neo @ - @ classical and beaux @ - @ arts architectural style , many of which were designed by prominent filipino architects during the american rule in the 1920s to the late 1930s . [SEP]
[CLS] many architects , artists , historians and heritage advocacy groups are pushing for the revival of escolta street , which was once the premier street of the philippines . [SEP] unfortunately , much of manila ' s prewar and spanish colonial architecture was destroyed during world war ii . [SEP]
[CLS] reconstruction took place afterwards , replacing the destroyed historic spanish @ - @ era buildings with modern ones , erasing much of the city ' s character . [SEP] some buildings destroyed by the war have been reconstructed , such as the old legislative building ( national museum ) , ayuntamiento de manila ( bureau of the treasury ) and the currently under construction san ignacio church ( museo de intramuros ) . [SEP]
[CLS] plans have been laid out to rehabilitate several neglected historic buildings and places such as plaza del carmen , san sebastian church and the manila metropolitan theater and soon spanish @ - @ era shops and houses in quiapo , binondo , and san nicolas will be restored to its former splendor , as a part of a movement to restore manila to its former glory . [SEP] since manila is prone to earthquakes , the spanish colonial architects invented the style called earthquake baroque which the churches and government buildings during the spanish colonial period adopted . [SEP]
[CLS] as a result , succeeding earthquakes of the 18th and 19th centuries barely affected manila , although it did periodically level the surrounding area . [SEP] modern buildings in and around manila are designed or have retrofitted to withstand an 8 @ . @ 2 magnitude quake in accordance to the country ' s building code . [SEP]
[CLS] manila is composed of fourteen districts according to republic act no . 409 , otherwise known as the revised charter of the city of manila . [SEP] two were later added , which are santa mesa ( partitioned off from sampaloc ) and san andres ( partitioned off from santa ana ) . [SEP]
[CLS] the city has 896 barangays that are known by sequential numbers instead of names . [SEP] these barangays are further group into 100 zones for administrative and municipal purposes . [SEP]
[CLS] the headquarters of the philippine coast guard is located at the south harbor in port area near intramuros and ermita . [SEP] the philippine navy on the other hand has its headquarters in naval station jose andrada located along roxas boulevard in malate . [SEP]
[CLS] furthermore , the afp joint task force @ - @ national capital region was created in 2012 to ensure peace and stability in metro manila , of which manila is a part . [SEP] it bears the same functions of the deactivated national capital regional command , although it operates on a much smaller size than its predecessor . [SEP]
[CLS] there are an estimated 4 million slum dwellers living in manila as of 2014 . [SEP] according to the 2015 census , the population of the city was 1 @ , @ 780 @ , @ 148 , making it the second most populous city in the philippines . [SEP]

[CLS] the vernacular language is filipino , based mostly on the tagalog of surrounding areas , and this manila form of speaking tagalog has essentially become the lingua franca of the philippines , having spread throughout the archipelago through mass media and entertainment . [SEP] meanwhile , english is the language most widely used in education , business , and heavily in everyday usage throughout the metro manila region and the philippines itself . [SEP]
[CLS] a number of older residents can still speak basic spanish , which used to be a mandatory subject in the curriculum of philippine universities and colleges , and many children of japanese filipino , indian filipino , and other migrants or expatriates also speak their parents ' languages at home , aside from english and / or filipino for everyday use . [SEP] minnan chinese ( known as lannang @ - @ oe ) is spoken by the city ' s chinese @ - @ filipino community . [SEP]
[CLS] the city is a major center for commerce , banking and finance , retailing , transportation , tourism , real estate , new media as well as traditional media , advertising , legal services , accountancy , insurance , theater , fashion , and the arts in the philippines . [SEP] the cities and municipalities competitiveness index , published by the national competitiveness council of the philippines , ranks the cities , municipalities and provinces of the country according to their economic dynamism , government efficiency and infrastructure . [SEP]
[CLS] manila placed third in the highly urbanized city ( huc ) category . [SEP] previously , manila was the country ' s most competitive city in 2015 , making it the best place to live in and do business . [SEP]
[CLS] the port of manila is the largest seaport in the philippines , making it the premier international shipping gateway to the country . [SEP] the philippine ports authority is government agency responsible to oversee the operation and management of the ports . [SEP]
[CLS] the international container terminal services inc . cited by the asian development bank as one of the top five major maritime terminal operators in the world has its headquarters and main operations on the ports of manila . [SEP] another port operator , the asian terminal incorporated , has its corporate office and main operations in the manila south harbor and its container depository located in santa mesa . [SEP]
[CLS] binondo , the oldest and one of the largest chinatown in the world , was the center of commerce and business activities in the city . [SEP] numerous residential and office skyscrapers are found within its medieval streets . [SEP]
[CLS] plans to make the chinatown area into a business process outsourcing ( bpo ) hub progresses and is aggressively pursued by the city government of manila . [SEP] 30 buildings are already identified to be converted into bpo offices . [SEP]
[CLS] these buildings are mostly located along the escolta street of binondo , which are all unoccupied and can be converted into offices . [SEP] divisoria in tondo is dubbed as the " shopping mecca of the philippines " . [SEP]
[CLS] numerous shopping malls are located in this place , which sells products and goods at bargain price . [SEP] small vendors occupies several roads that causes pedestrian and vehicular traffic . [SEP]

[SEP] it attracts 1 million people every month , but is expected to add another 400 @ , @ 000 people when the lrt @ - @ 2 west extension is constructed , making it manila ' s busiest transfer station . [CLS] the pandacan oil depot houses the storage facilities and distribution terminals of the three major players in the country ' s petroleum industry , namely caltex philippines , pilipinas shell and petron corporation . [SEP] the oil depot has been a subject of various concerns , including its environmental and health impact to the residents of manila . [SEP]
[CLS] the supreme court has ordered that the oil depot to be relocated outside the city by july 2015 , but it failed to meet this deadline . [SEP] it is currently being demolished which is expected to be finished before the year 2016 ends , and plans have been set up to turn this 33 hectare facility into a transport hub or even a food park . [CLS] manila is a major publishing center in the philippines . [SEP] manila bulletin , the philippines ' largest broadsheet newspaper by circulation , is headquartered inside intramuros . [SEP]

[CLS] major destinations include the walled city of intramuros , the national theater at the cultural center of the philippines , manila ocean park , binondo , ermita , malate , manila zoo , national museum of the philippines and rizal park . [SEP] rizal park , also known as luneta park , is the national park of the country and has an area of 58 hectares ( 140 acres ) , making it the largest urban park in asia . [SEP]
[CLS] in the tourism act of 2009 , rizal park along with intramuros are designated as flagship destination to become a tourism enterprise zone . [SEP] a new attraction called paseo de manila is expected to rise in the park . [SEP]
[CLS] the park was constructed as an honor and dedication to the country ' s national hero jose rizal , who was executed by the spaniards on charges of subversion . [SEP] the flagpole west of the rizal monument is the kilometer zero marker for distances to the rest of the country . [SEP]
[CLS] intramuros is the historic center of manila . [SEP] originally , it was considered to be manila itself at the time when the philippines was under the spanish empire colonial rule . [SEP]
[CLS] owing to its history and cultural value , intramuros and rizal park are designated as flagship destination to become a tourism enterprise zone in the tourism act of 2009 . [SEP] intramuros is managed by the intramuros administration ( ia ) . [SEP]
[CLS] the architecture of intramuros reflects the spanish colonial style and the american neoclassical architectural style , since the philippines was a colony of spain and the united states before it is granted its independence in 1946 . [SEP] kalesa is a popular mode of transportation in intramuros and nearby places such as binondo , ermita and the rizal park . [SEP]
[CLS] popular tourist destinations in intramuros include the baluarte de san diego , club intramuros golf course , cuartel de santa lucia , fort santiago , manila cathedral , palacio arzobispal , palacio de santa potenciana , palacio del gobernador , plaza mexico , plaza de roma , san agustin church and the ayuntamiento de manila . [SEP] some of the country ' s oldest schools are founded in intramuros , these are the university of santo tomas ( 1611 ) , colegio de san juan de letran ( 1620 ) , and ateneo de manila university ( 1859 ) . [SEP]
[CLS] only colegio de san juan de letran remains at intramuros ; the university of santo tomas transferred to a new campus at sampaloc in 1927 , and ateneo left intramuros for loyola heights , quezon city ( while still retaining " de manila " in its name ) in 1952 . [SEP] other prominent educational institutions include the manila high school and the university of the city of manila . [SEP]
[CLS] the department of tourism designates manila as the pioneer of medical tourism , expecting it to generate $ 1 billion in revenue annually . [SEP] however , lack of progressive health system , inadequate infrastructure and the unstable political environment are seen as hindrances for its growth . [SEP]

[CLS] manila is the site of prominent catholic churches and institutions . [SEP] the manila cathedral is the seat of the roman catholic archdiocese of manila and the oldest established church in the country . [SEP]
[CLS] aside from the manila cathedral , there are also three other basilicas in the city : quiapo church , binondo church , and the minor basilica of san sebastian . [SEP] the san agustin church in intramuros is a unesco world heritage site and is one of the two fully air @ - @ conditioned catholic churches in the city . [SEP]

[SEP] the national spiritual assembly of the baha ' is of the philippines , the governing body of the filipino baha ' i community , is headquartered near manila ' s eastern border with makati . [SEP]
[CLS] manila celebrates civic and national holidays . [SEP] manila day , which celebrates the city ' s founding on june 24 , 1571 , was first proclaimed by herminio a . astorga ( then vice mayor of manila ) on june 24 , 1962 and has been annually commemorated , under the patronage of john the baptist . [SEP]
[CLS] locally , each of the city ' s barangays also have their own festivities guided by their own patron saint . [SEP] the city is also the host to the feast of the black nazarene , held every january 9 , which draws millions of catholic devotees . [SEP]
[CLS] another religious feasts held in manila was the feast of the nuestra senora de los desamparados de manila ( our lady of the abandoned ) , the patron saint of santa ana and was held every may 12 . [SEP] non @ - @ religious holidays include the new year ' s day , national heroes ' day , bonifacio day and rizal day . [SEP]
[CLS] as the cultural center of the philippines , manila is the home to a number of museums . [SEP] the national museum of the philippines complex , which include the national museum of fine arts , museum of anthropology and the museum of natural history , is located on the northeast part of rizal park facing taft avenue . [SEP]
[CLS] proposed national government center during the american time . [SEP] museums established by educational institutions include the mabini shrine , the museum of contemporary art and design , ust museum of arts and sciences , and the up museum of a history of ideas . [SEP]
[CLS] bahay tsinoy , one of manila ' s most prominent museums , documents the chinese lives and contributions in the history of the philippines . [SEP] the intramuros light and sound museum chronicles the filipinos desire for freedom during the revolution under rizal ' s leadership and other revolutionary leaders . [SEP]
[CLS] the metropolitan museum of manila exhibits the filipino arts and culture . [SEP] other museums in the city are the museum of manila , the city @ - @ owned museum that exhibits the city ' s culture and history , museo pambata , a children ' s museum , the museum of philippine political history , which exhibits notable political events in the country , the parish of the our lady of the abandoned and the san agustin church museum , which houses religious artifacts , and plaza san luis , a public museum . [SEP]
[CLS] sports in manila have a long and distinguished history . [SEP] the city ' s , and in general the country ' s main sport is basketball , and most barangays have a makeshift basketball court , with court markings drawn on the streets . [SEP]
[CLS] larger barangays have covered courts where interbarangay leagues are held every summer ( april to may ) . [SEP] the city has several well @ - @ known sports venues , such as the rizal memorial sports complex and san andres gym , the home of the now defunct manila metrostars . [SEP]
[CLS] the rizal memorial sports complex houses the rizal memorial track and football stadium , the baseball stadium , tennis courts , memorial coliseum and the ninoy aquino stadium ( the latter two are indoor arenas ) . [SEP] the rizal complex had hosted several multi @ - @ sport events , such as the 1954 asian games and the 1934 far eastern games . [SEP]
[CLS] whenever the country hosts the southeast asian games , most of the events are held at the complex , but in the 2005 games , most events were held elsewhere . [SEP] the 1960 abc championship and the 1973 abc championship , forerunners of the fiba asia championship , was hosted by the complex , with the national basketball team winning on both tournaments . [SEP]
[CLS] the 1978 fiba world championship was held at the complex although the latter stages were held in the araneta coliseum in quezon city , southeast asia ' s largest indoor arena at that time . [SEP] manila also hosts several well @ - @ known sports facilities such as the enrique m . razon sports center and the university of santo tomas sports complex , both of which are private venues owned by a university ; collegiate sports are also held , with the university athletic association of the philippines and the national collegiate athletic association basketball games held at rizal memorial coliseum and ninoy aquino stadium , although basketball events had transferred to san juan ' s filoil flying v arena and the araneta coliseum in quezon city . [SEP]
[CLS] other collegiate sports are still held at the rizal memorial sports complex . [SEP] professional basketball also used to play at the city , but the philippine basketball association now holds their games at araneta coliseum and cuneta astrodome at pasay ; the now defunct philippine basketball league played some of their games at the rizal memorial sports complex . [SEP]
[CLS] the manila storm are the city ' s rugby league team training at rizal park ( luneta park ) and playing their matches at southern plains field , calamba , laguna . [SEP] previously a widely played sport in the city , manila is now the home of the only sizable baseball stadium in the country , at the rizal memorial baseball stadium . [SEP]
[CLS] the stadium hosts games of baseball philippines ; lou gehrig and babe ruth were the first players to score a home run at the stadium at their tour of the country on december 2 , 1934 . [SEP] another popular sport in the city are cue sports , and billiard halls are a feature in most barangays . [SEP]
[CLS] the 2010 world cup of pool was held at robinsons place manila . [SEP] the rizal memorial track and football stadium hosted the first fifa world cup qualifier in decades when the philippines hosted sri lanka in july 2011 . [SEP]
[CLS] the stadium , which was previously unfit for international matches , had undergone a major renovation program prior to the match . [SEP] the football stadium now regularly hosts matches of the united football league . [SEP]
[CLS] the stadium also hosted its first rugby test when it hosted the 2012 asian five nations division i tournaments . [SEP] the government of manila is divided into three branches : executive , legislative and judiciary . [SEP]
[CLS] the judicial branch is administered solely by the supreme court of the philippines under the metro manila judicial region . [SEP] the city government have control of the executive and legislative branch . [SEP]
[CLS] manila employs 11 @ , @ 919 personnel at the end of 2014 . [SEP] the current mayor of manila is joseph estrada , who served as the president of the philippines from 1998 @ - @ 2001 . [SEP]
[CLS] he is also the head of the executive department of the city . [SEP] the legislative arm which is composed of six elected city councilors , is headed by the vice mayor . [SEP]
[CLS] former actor isko moreno currently serves as the city ' s vice mayor . [SEP] altogether they are assisted by the manila city council , the local president of the association of barangay captains , and the president of the sangguniang kabataan . [SEP]
[CLS] their offices are located at the manila city hall . [SEP] on september 25 , 2014 , the commission on audit released its 2013 annual financial report citing the city ' s income at ₱ 10 @ . @ 1 billion with an asset worth of ₱ 18 @ . @ 6 billion . [SEP]
[CLS] its local income stood at ₱ 5 @ . @ 41 billion and its national government allocation was ₱ 1 @ . @ 74 billion , having an annual regular income ( ari ) of an estimated ₱ 7 @ . @ 15 billion . [SEP] manila ' s net income stood at ₱ 3 @ . @ 54 billion in 2014 . [SEP]
[CLS] among the local government units , manila has the highest budget allocation to health . [SEP] it was also one of the cities with the highest tax and internal revenue . [SEP]
[CLS] tax revenue accounts for 46 % of the city ' s income in 2012 . [SEP] manila has six legislative districts that serve as the constituencies for the election of the city ' s representatives to the lower house of the congress of the philippines and of the regular members to the sangguniang panlungsod ( sp ; city council ) . [SEP]
[CLS] each district elects one representative to the house of representatives and six sp members to the council . [SEP] the city , along with the rest of the nation , elects 12 senators as one at @ - @ large district . [SEP]
[CLS] manila is politically divided into 896 barangays , the smallest unit of local government in the philippines . [SEP] each barangay has its own chairperson and councilors . [SEP]
[CLS] for administrative convenience , all the barangays in manila are grouped into 100 zones . [SEP] these zones have no form of local government . [SEP]
[CLS] the 1st district ( 2015 population : 415 @ , @ 906 ) is manila ' s ( and the country ' s ) most densely populated congressional district . [SEP] it covers the western portion of tondo that lies along manila bay . [SEP]
[CLS] the 2nd district ( 2015 population : 215 @ , @ 457 ) covers the eastern inland portion of tondo , a neighborhood or sub @ - @ district known as gagalangin . [SEP] the 3rd district ( 2015 population : 197 @ , @ 242 ) covers binondo , quiapo , san nicolas and santa cruz . [SEP]
[CLS] the 4th district ( 2015 population : 265 @ , @ 046 ) covers sampaloc . [SEP] the 5th district ( 2015 population : 366 @ , @ 714 ) covers ermita , malate , port area , intramuros , san andres bukid , and a portion of paco ( except zone 90 ) . [SEP]
[CLS] the 6th district ( 2007 population : 295 @ , @ 245 ) covers paco ( zone 90 only ) , pandacan , san miguel , santa ana and santa mesa . [SEP] manila has the most number of barangays of any city or municipality in the philippines . [SEP]
[CLS] attempts at reducing its number have not prospered despite local legislation — ordinance 7907 , passed on 23 april 1996 — reducing the number from 897 to 150 by merging existing barangays , because of the failure to hold a plebiscite . [SEP] manila , being the seat of political power of the philippines , has several national government offices headquartered at the city . [SEP]
[CLS] planning for the development for being the center of government started during the early years of american colonization to the country when they envisioned a well @ - @ designed city outside the walls of intramuros . [SEP] the strategic location chosen was bagumbayan , a former town which is now the rizal park to become the center of government and a design commission was given to daniel burnham to create a master plan for the city patterned after washington d . c . . [SEP]
[CLS] these improvements were eventually abandoned under the commonwealth government of manuel l . quezon . [SEP] a new government center was to be built on the hills northeast of manila , or what is now quezon city . [SEP]
[CLS] several government agencies have set up their headquarters in quezon city but several key government offices still reside in manila . [SEP] however , many of the plans were substantially altered after the devastation of manila during world war ii and by subsequent administrations . [SEP]
[CLS] the city , as the capital , still hosts the office of the president , as well as the president ' s official residence . [SEP] aside from these , important institutions such as the supreme court , the court of appeals , the bangko sentral ng pilipinas , the departments of budget and management , finance , health , justice , labor and employment and public works and highways still call the city home . [SEP]
[CLS] manila also hosts important national institutions such as the national library , national archives , national museum and the philippine general hospital . [SEP] congress previously held office at the old congress building . [SEP]
[CLS] in 1972 , due to declaration of martial law , congress was dissolved ; its successor , the unicameral batasang pambansa , held office at the new batasang pambansa complex . [SEP] when a new constitution restored the bicameral congress , the house of representatives stayed at the batasang pambansa complex , while the senate remained at the old congress building . [SEP]
[CLS] in may 1997 , the senate transferred to a new building it shares with the government service insurance system at reclaimed land at pasay . [SEP] water services used to be provided by the metropolitan waterworks and sewerage system , which served 30 % of the city with most other sewage being directly dumped into storm drains , septic tanks , or open canals . [SEP]
[CLS] mwss was privatized in 1997 which split the water concession into the east and west zones . [SEP] the maynilad water services took over the west zone of which manila is a part . [SEP]
[CLS] it now provides the supply and delivery of potable water and sewerage system in manila , but it does not provide service to the southeastern part of the city which belongs to the east zone that is served by manila water . [SEP] electric services are provided by meralco , the sole electric power distributor in metro manila . [SEP]
[CLS] one of the more famous modes of transportation in manila is the jeepney . [SEP] patterned after u . s . army jeeps , these have been in use since the years immediately following world war ii . [SEP]
[CLS] the tamaraw fx , the third generation toyota kijang , which competed directly with jeepneys and followed fixed routes for a set price , once plied the streets of manila . [SEP] on a for @ - @ hire basis , the city is served by numerous taxicabs , " tricycles " ( motorcycles with sidecars , the philippine version of the auto rickshaw ) , and " trisikads " or " sikads " ( bicycles with a sidecars , the philippine version of pedicabs ) . [SEP]
[CLS] in some areas , especially in divisoria , motorized pedicabs are popular . [SEP] spanish @ - @ era horse @ - @ drawn calesas are still a popular tourist attraction and mode of transportation in the streets of binondo and intramuros . [SEP]
[CLS] all types of public road transport are privately owned and operated under government franchise . [SEP] the city is serviced by the lrt @ - @ 1 and lrt @ - @ 2 which forms the lrta system , as distinct from the mrt @ - @ 3 which is under the mrtc system that services other parts of metro manila . [SEP]
[CLS] development of the railway system began in the 1970s under the marcos administration , making it the first light rail transport in southeast asia . [SEP] these systems are currently undergoing a multibillion @ - @ dollar expansion . [SEP]
[CLS] lrt line 1 runs along the length of taft avenue ( r @ - @ 2 ) and rizal avenue ( r @ - @ 9 ) , and the lrt line 2 runs along claro m . recto avenue ( c @ - @ 1 ) and ramon magsaysay boulevard ( r @ - @ 6 ) from santa cruz , through quezon city , up to santolan in marikina . [SEP] the main terminal of the philippine national railways lies within the city . [SEP]
[CLS] one commuter railway within metro manila is in operation . [SEP] the line runs in a general north @ - @ south direction from tutuban ( tondo ) toward laguna . [SEP]
[CLS] the port of manila , located in the vicinity of manila bay is the chief seaport of the philippines . [SEP] the pasig river ferry service which runs on the pasig river is another form of transportation . [SEP]
[CLS] the city is also served by the ninoy aquino international airport and clark international airport . [SEP] in 2006 , forbes magazine ranked manila " the world ' s most congested city " . [SEP]
[CLS] manila has become notorious for its frequent traffic jams and high densities . [SEP] the government has undertaken several projects to alleviate the traffic in the city . [SEP]
[CLS] some of the projects include : the construction of a new flyover at sampaloc , the construction of the metro manila skyway stage 3 , the proposed lrt line 2 ( west ) extension from recto to tondo or the port area , and the expansion of several national and local roads . [SEP] however , such projects have yet to make any meaningful impact , and the traffic jams and congestion continue unabated . [SEP]
[CLS] the urban planning of the manila and the whole metropolis was based on the metro manila dream plan , which seeks to address the problems of metro manila ' s urban planning and transportation . [SEP] it consists of a list of short term priority projects and medium to long term infrastructure projects that will last up to 2030 . [SEP]
[CLS] the manila health department is responsible for the planning and implementation of the health care programs provided by the city government . [SEP] it operates 59 health centers and six city @ - @ run hospitals , which are free of charge . [SEP]
[CLS] the six public city @ - @ run hospitals are the ospital ng maynila medical center , ospital ng sampaloc , gat andres bonifacio memorial medical center , ospital ng tondo , sta . [SEP] ana hospital , and justice jose abad santos general hospital . [SEP]
[CLS] manila is also the site of the philippine general hospital , the tertiary state @ - @ owned hospital administered and operated by the university of the philippines manila . [SEP] manila ' s healthcare is also provided by private corporations . [SEP]
[CLS] private hospitals that operates in the city are the manila doctors hospital , chinese general hospital and medical center , dr . jose r . reyes memorial medical center , metropolitan medical center , our lady of lourdes hospital , and the university of santo tomas hospital . [SEP] the department of health has its main office in manila . [SEP]
[CLS] the national health department also operates the san lazaro hospital , a special referral tertiary hospital . [SEP] manila is also the home to the headquarters of the world health organization regional office for the western pacific and the world health organization country office for the philippines . [SEP]
[CLS] the center of education since the colonial period , manila — particularly intramuros — is home to several philippine universities and colleges as well as its oldest ones . [SEP] it served as the home of the university of santo tomas ( 1611 ) , colegio de san juan de letran ( 1620 ) , ateneo de manila university ( 1859 ) , lyceum of the philippines university and the mapua institute of technology . [SEP]
[CLS] only colegio de san juan de letran ( 1620 ) remains at intramuros ; the university of santo tomas transferred to a new campus at sampaloc in 1927 , and ateneo left intramuros for loyola heights , quezon city ( while still retaining " de manila " in its name ) in 1952 . [SEP] the university of the city of manila ( pamantasan ng lungsod ng maynila ) located at intramuros , and universidad de manila located just outside the walled city , are both owned and operated by the manila city government . [SEP]
[CLS] the national government controls the university of the philippines manila , the oldest of the university of the philippines constituent universities and the center of health sciences education in the country . [SEP] the city is also the site of the polytechnic university of the philippines , the largest university in the country in terms of student population . [SEP]
[CLS] the university belt refers to the area where there is a high concentration or a cluster of colleges and universities in the city and it is commonly understood as the one where the san miguel , quiapo and sampaloc districts meet . [SEP] generally , it includes the western end of espana boulevard , nicanor reyes st . ( formerly morayta st . ) , the eastern end of claro m . recto avenue ( formerly azcarraga ) , legarda avenue , mendiola street , and the different side streets . [SEP]
[CLS] each of the colleges and universities found here are at a short walking distance of each other . [SEP] another cluster of colleges lies along the southern bank of the pasig river , mostly at the intramuros and ermita districts , and still a smaller cluster is found at the southernmost part of malate near the border with pasay such as the private co @ - @ educational institution of de la salle university , the largest of all de la salle university system of schools . [SEP]
[CLS] the division of the city schools of manila , a branch of the department of education , refers to the city ' s three @ - @ tier public education system . [SEP] it governs the 71 public elementary schools , 32 public high schools . [SEP]
[CLS] the city also contains the manila science high school , the pilot science high school of the philippines ; the national museum , where the spoliarium of juan luna is housed ; the metropolitan museum of manila , a museum of modern and contemporary visual arts ; the museo pambata , the children ' s museum , a place of hands @ - @ on discovery and fun learning ; and , the national library , the repository of the country ' s printed and recorded cultural heritage and other literary and information resources . [SEP] sister cities of manila attalea is a large genus of palms native to mexico , the caribbean , central and south america . [SEP]
[CLS] this pinnately leaved , non @ - @ spiny genus includes both small palms lacking an aboveground stem and large trees . [SEP] the genus has a complicated taxonomic history , and has often been split into four or five genera based on differences in the male flowers . [SEP]
[CLS] since the genera can only be distinguished on the basis of their male flowers , the existence of intermediate flower types and the existence of hybrids between different genera has been used as an argument for keeping them all in the same genus . [SEP] this has been supported by a recent molecular phylogeny . [SEP]
[CLS] somewhere between 29 and 67 species are recognised in the genus , with estimates of as many as 100 . [SEP] incomplete herbarium collections make it difficult to determine whether certain groups represent single species , or groups of similar species . [SEP]
[CLS] attalea species have a long history of human use , and include economically important sources of palm oil and fibre . [SEP] many species are fire tolerant and thrive in disturbed habitats . [SEP]
[CLS] their seeds are animal dispersed , including some which are thought to have been adapted for dispersal by now @ - @ extinct pleistocene megafauna . [SEP] the genus attalea has pinnately compound leaves — rows of leaflets emerge on either side of the axis of the leaf in a feather @ - @ like or fern @ - @ like pattern . [SEP]
[CLS] species are also non @ - @ spiny palms and includes both large trees with stout stems up to 30 metres ( 98 ft ) tall and acaulescent palms ( one which lack an aboveground stem ) . [SEP] the number of leaves per individual varies from about three to thirty @ - @ five ; larger plants tend to have more and longer leaves . [SEP]
[CLS] inflorescences are large , branched and borne among the leaves . [SEP] the inflorescence consists of a main axis — the peduncle and the rachis — and a series of smaller branches , the rachillae . [SEP]
[CLS] the rachillae , which bear the flowers , emerge from the rachis . [SEP] the peduncle is the main stalk , connecting the rachis with the stem . [SEP]
[CLS] inflorescences either consist entirely of male flowers , or are predominantly female with a few male flowers . [SEP] fruit usually have two or three seeds , although fewer or more are present in some species , and are usually brown , yellow , orange @ - @ brown or purple when mature . [SEP]
[CLS] four different types of male flowers exist . [SEP] on the basis of these flower types , the genus has often been split into four genera — a more narrowly defined attalea , orbignya , maximiliana and scheelea . [SEP]
[CLS] the species sometimes referred to orbignya have coiled anthers , while the other groups have straight ones . [SEP] the petals of those placed in maximiliana are much shorter than the stamens , while those placed in scheelea and a more narrowly defined attalea have petals that are longer than the stamens . [SEP]
[CLS] five species do not fit easily into any of these groups ; this fact has been used as an argument in favour of considering this group a single genus . [SEP] attalea has been placed in the subfamily arecoideae , the tribe cocoseae and the subtribe attaleinae , together with the genera allagoptera , beccariophoenix , butia , cocos , jubaea , jubaeopsis , lytocaryum , parajubaea , syagrus and voanioala . [SEP]
[CLS] within this subtribe , attalea has been found to be a monophyletic group , and sister to the clade containing allagoptera , polyandrococos , parajubaea , butia and jubaea . [SEP] disagreement exists as to whether attalea should be considered a single genus , or a group of related genera . [SEP]
[CLS] in their 1996 field guide to the palms of the americas , andrew henderson , gloria galeano and rodrigo bernal combined all the species in the subtribe attaleinae ( as it was then defined ) into a single genus , attalea . [SEP] in his 1999 taxonomic treatment of palm subtribe attaleinae , american botanist sidney f . glassman divided the group into five genera — a more narrowly defined attalea , orbignya , maximiliana , scheelea and ynesa . [SEP]
[CLS] rafael govaerts and john dransfield recognised a single genus in their 2005 world checklist of palms , and jean @ - @ christophe pintaud continued this usage in his 2008 review of the genus . [SEP] the multi @ - @ genus approach is based solely on the structure of the male flowers ; no other characters could be consistently associated with one genus or another . [SEP]
[CLS] four of the genera — attalea ( in a narrow sense ) , orbignya , maximiliana and scheelea — correspond to four different types of male flowers found within the genus . [SEP] however , a few species have flowers that are intermediate between these four types , including a . colenda ( which glassman placed in its own genus , ynesa ) and this has been used as an argument for the single @ - @ genus approach . [SEP]
[CLS] in addition , there are several hybrids between species that would be considered different genera under glassman ' s five @ - @ genus system , which has also been used as an argument for placing them in a single genus . [SEP] in 2009 alan meerow and colleagues published a molecular phylogeny of the subtribe which found that some species placed in orbignya were actually more closely related to species placed in scheelea than they were to other members of that genus ( if the five @ - @ genus approach was used ) , while a . crassispatha , placed in orbignya by glassman , was actually a sister to both scheelea and orbignya . [SEP]
[CLS] the genus attalea was first described carl sigismund kunth in 1816 based on specimens collected by alexander von humboldt and aime bonpland , although older , pre @ - @ linnaean descriptions exist , including charles plumier ' s 1703 description of a . crassispatha . [SEP] the genus was named for attalus iii philometor , king of pergamon , known for his interest in medicinal plants . [SEP]
[CLS] the type species is a . amygdalina , a colombian endemic . [SEP] the genera maximiliana and orbignya were described by carl friedrich philipp von martius in 1826 and 1837 respectively . [SEP]
[CLS] scheelea was described by hermann karsten in 1857 , and ynesa by orator f . cook in 1942 . [SEP] experts disagree about the number of species in the genus attalea ( broadly defined ) . [SEP]
[CLS] in 1965 , dutch taxonomist jan gerard wessels boer estimated that there may be as many as 100 species in the genus . [SEP] in their 1996 field guide to the palms of the americas andrew henderson and coauthors recognised 29 species in the genus , while sidney glassman recognised 65 species in his 1999 treatment of the group . [SEP]
[CLS] largely following glassman ' s lead , rafael govaerts and john dransfield recognised 67 species in their 2005 world checklist of palms . [SEP] an important element of this disagreement is the decision by glassman to define species more narrowly than henderson . [SEP]
[CLS] as a result , what henderson interpreted as variation within species , glassman took as differences between morphologically similar species . [SEP] this problem is complicated by the fact that many of these species are poorly represented in herbarium collections . [SEP]
[CLS] the large size of the leaves , inflorescences and fruit of many attalea species makes them difficult to collect . [SEP] in addition , many important collections , including type specimen , have been lost or destroyed . [SEP]
[CLS] sparse or incomplete collections make it difficult to differentiate variation within a single species from variation between different species . [SEP] the three recent treatments ( henderson and coauthors , glassman , and govaerts and dransfield ) recognised a total of 73 species , but only 20 species are accepted by all of them . [SEP]
[CLS] the remainder account for either nine species or more than 40 . [SEP] for example , what andrew henderson considered a single species , attalea attaleoides , other authors have considered a species complex consisting of four or five species . [SEP]
[CLS] glassman doubted the validity of a . attaleoides as a species , and described four new species from material that had previously been attributed to a . attaleoides — a . camopiensis , a . degranvillei , a . guianensis and a . maripensis . [SEP] govaerts and dransfield accepted both glassman ' s four species and a . attaleoides . [SEP]
[CLS] however , jean @ - @ christophe pintaud was of the opinion that a . guianensis , a . maripensis and a . attaleoides were all very similar , and thought it likely that they all represented the same species . [SEP] another species complex in attalea includes a . speciosa and related species . [SEP]
[CLS] henderson ( 1995 ) recognised a . speciosa and a . spectabilis , considering the latter to either be an acaulescent form of a . speciosa or a hybrid between it and a . microcarpa . [SEP] govaerts and dransfield accepted a . spectabilis , but glassman considered it a dubious taxon . [SEP]
[CLS] attalea vitrivir was recognised as a distinct species by michael balick and coauthors ; glassman and govaerts and dransfield concurred , but henderson considered it part of a . speciosa . [SEP] glassman also described a fourth member of this group , a . brejinhoensis , and it is accepted by govaerts and dransfield . [SEP]
[CLS] attalea species are monoecious — male and female flowers are separate , but are borne by the same plant . [SEP] various species have been described as being insect @ - @ pollinated , including a . phalerata , while pollination in a . colenda and a . speciosa , has been attributed both to insects and wind . [SEP]
[CLS] seed germination is remote tubular — during germination , as the cotyledon expands it pushes the young shoot away from the seed . [SEP] after germination , the stem initially grows downward before turning to grow upward and produce the aboveground stem . [SEP]
[CLS] this produces a " saxophone shaped " belowground portion of the stem . [SEP] the fact that the shoot tips of attalea seedlings are underground it likely to contribute to their fire @ - @ tolerance . [SEP]
[CLS] species range across the neotropics from mexico in the north to bolivia , paraguay , and southern brazil in the south . [SEP] according to govaerts and coauthors , three species are found in mexico , four in central america , and 62 in south america . [SEP]
[CLS] three species are present in the caribbean — two in trinidad and tobago , along the southern edge of the region , and one in haiti . [SEP] attalea includes both large trees and small acaulescent palms which occupy a number of different ecological niches . [SEP]
[CLS] dense stands of some of the larger species are conspicuous elements on the landscape , while smaller species are found in both in the forest understorey and in savannas . [SEP] disturbance has been implicated in the formation of vegetation dominated by large attalea species . [SEP]
[CLS] in seasonally dry amazonian forests the density of large adult a . maripa palms was correlated with canopy openness ; the species also dominates savannas formed by repeated forest fires in trinidad and tobago . [SEP] attalea speciosa forms pure stands in many parts of brazil where natural forest vegetation has been cleared . [SEP]
[CLS] similarly , stands of a . funifera in bahia , brazil ( which are cultivated for piassava fibre ) are managed using fire — the seedlings survive cutting and burning , and are able to dominate burned forest patches . [SEP] the fruit are dispersed by animals ; fruit which are not dispersed frequently suffer seed predation by bruchid beetles . [SEP]
[CLS] certain species of attalea have been mentioned as examples of " anachronistic " species which are adapted for dispersal by now @ - @ extinct pleistocene megafauna . [SEP] on maraca island , roraima , in the brazilian amazon , attalea maripa fruit were consumed by tapirs , collared peccaries , deer and primates . [SEP]
[CLS] rodents , including agoutis , fed upon the fruit and , as the fruit availability declined , they fed on the seeds . [SEP] other dispersers of attalea fruit include crested caracaras which consume the fruit and disperse the seeds of a . phalerata in the brazilian pantanal . [SEP]
[CLS] attalea species have a long history of human utilisation . [SEP] carbonised attalea maripa seeds have been found in archaeological sites in colombia dating back to 9000 bp . [SEP]
[CLS] a variety of species remain important sources of edible oil , thatch , edible seeds and fibre . [SEP] the leaves of attalea butyracea and a . maripa are used extensively for thatching . [SEP]
[CLS] several species are oil palms , with a . speciosa among the most important economically . [SEP] products extracted from a . speciosa were reported to support over 300 @ , @ 000 households in the brazilian state of maranhao in 2005 , and in 1985 it was estimated to support over 450 @ , @ 000 households throughout the brazil . [SEP]
[CLS] piassava fibres , extracted from the leaf bases of a . funifera , are commercially important , and generated about us $ 20 million in annual income to brazilian farmers in 1996 . [SEP] the heart of ezra greer is a 1917 american silent drama film produced by the thanhouser company and directed by emile chautard . [SEP]
[CLS] the film focuses on ezra greer , a successful middle @ - @ aged man who searches for his college age daughter , mary . [SEP] the wayward mary was romanced and abandoned by jack denbeigh , later bearing his child . [SEP]
[CLS] once ezra becomes broke he finds employment as the valet for jack denbeigh . [SEP] after jack ' s engagement to a cabaret girl , mary becomes upset and leaves her child at jack ' s home . [SEP]
[CLS] contrary to jack ' s wishes , ezra keeps the child and jack ultimately reveals that the child is his own . [SEP] ezra convinces jack to make things right and ezra convinces the cabaret girl to leave jack . [SEP]
[CLS] after a carriage accident in which the baby is injured , ezra and jack rush to the hospital and find mary as a nurse crying over the child . [SEP] the film ends with the marriage of jack and mary . [SEP]
[CLS] the film was released by pathe on october 7 , 1917 . [SEP] the film was the final release from thanhouser and was deemed to be an average film by most reviewers . [SEP]
[CLS] criticism for the film hinged on far @ - @ fetched coincidences to drive the plot . [SEP] the film is presumed lost . [SEP]
[CLS] the film follows ezra greer , a middle @ - @ aged man who has worked hard since his youth . [SEP] he cares deeply for his motherless daughter , mary , but was unable to attend the annual commencement at her co @ - @ educational college . [SEP]
[CLS] he awaits for her to return from college , but mary leaves with her romantic interest , jack denbeigh . [SEP] on promise of marriage and wealth , mary is romanced and gives birth to a fatherless child . [SEP]
[CLS] without word from his daughter , ezra resigns from his job and attempts to seek her out and finds a poor motherless child , marie . [SEP] with ezra ' s money exhausted he seeks employment and finds it as the valet of jack . [SEP]
[CLS] one day , mary seeks an announcement of jack ' s engagement to a cabaret girl known as " the baby vamp " . [SEP] bitter over the prospect of her child ' s future , she leaves the child at jack ' s home during his absence with a note . [SEP]
[CLS] jack orders ezra to take the baby to an orphanage , but marie begs ezra to keep him . [SEP] after continually seeing the child , jack is overcome with remorse and explains to ezra and seeks his advice . [SEP]
[CLS] not knowing he was making the case for his own daughter , ezra convinces jack to seek out mary and forget the baby vamp . [SEP] the baby vamp seeks out jack , but finds ezra who convinces her to leave jack . [SEP]
[CLS] jack ' s son is later injured in a coach accident and is taken to the hospital . [SEP] jack and ezra rush to the hospital and find mary , as a nurse , crying over the injured child . [SEP]
[CLS] ezra is enraged upon learning that his own daughter was mistreated by jack , but mary steps between the two men . [SEP] jack apologizes and wants to make it right . [SEP]
[CLS] the film concludes with jack and mary .
