[CLS] ( s . d . n . y . 1987 ) , which held that columbia pictures violated the copyright steinberg held on his work . [SEP] on june 5 , 2003 , during the first term of george w . bush ' s presidency , ted rall presented a view of the world from pennsylvania avenue as a parody of view of the world from 9th avenue in a universal press syndicate editorial cartoon . [SEP]
[CLS] he replaced the letters representing the new yorker with the bushie . [SEP] the cover was later satirized by barry blitt for the cover of the new yorker on october 6 , 2008 . [SEP]
[CLS] the cover featured sarah palin looking out of her window seeing only alaska , with russia in the far background . [SEP] the march 21 , 2009 the economist included a story entitled " how china sees the world " that presents a parody that is also an homage to the original image , but depicting the viewpoint from beijing ' s chang ' an avenue instead of manhattan . [SEP]
[CLS] a caption above the illustration reads " illustration by jon berkeley ( with apologies to steinberg and the new yorker ) " . [SEP] it accompanied an article that discussed the burgeoning chinese economy at the time of the contemporary financial crisis . [SEP]
[CLS] the october 1 , 2012 cover of mad magazine satirized the problems with the september release of apple inc . ' [SEP] s ios 6 mobile operating system which included apple maps , a replacement for google maps . [SEP]
[CLS] the work presents what view of the world might look like if one had relied upon the september 2012 version of apple maps to locate various landmarks . [SEP] on october 17 , 2005 , american society of magazine editors unveiled its list of the top 40 magazine covers of the prior 40 years and ranked view of the world from 9th avenue in fourth place . [SEP]
[CLS] the listing stated that the work " . . . has come to represent manhattan ' s telescoped perception of the country beyond the hudson river . [SEP] the cartoon showed the supposed limited mental geography of manhattanites . " [SEP]
[CLS] bintulu / biːnˈtuːluː / ( chinese : [SEP] 民 都 [UNK] ; pinyin : mindulu ; pe h @ - @ oe @ - @ ji : bin @ - @ to [SEP]
[CLS] - lo ) is a coastal town on the island of borneo in the central region of sarawak , malaysia . [SEP] bintulu is located 610 kilometres ( 380 mi ) northeast of kuching , 216 kilometres ( 134 mi ) northeast of sibu , and 200 kilometres ( 120 mi ) southwest of miri . [SEP]
[CLS] with a population of 114 @ , @ 058 as of 2010 , bintulu is the capital of the bintulu district of the bintulu division of sarawak , malaysia . [SEP] the name of bintulu was derived from the local native language " mentu ulau " ( picking heads ) . [SEP]
[CLS] bintulu was a small fishing village when rajah james brooke acquired it in 1861 . [SEP] brooke later built a fort there in 1862 . [SEP]
[CLS] in 1867 , the first general council meeting ( now sarawak state legislative assembly ) was convened in bintulu . [SEP] it is the earliest state legislature system in malaysia . [SEP]
[CLS] the construction of the earliest airstrip in bintulu began in 1934 but was halted in 1938 due to financial difficulties . [SEP] during world war ii , the airstrip was heavily bombed by allied forces . [SEP]
[CLS] the british later rebuilt the airstrip , and it became fully operational in 1955 . [SEP] the old airport was replaced by a new airport in 2002 . [SEP]
[CLS] bintulu remained a fishing village until 1969 when oil and gas reserves were discovered off the coast . [SEP] since then , bintulu has become the centre of energy intensive industries such as a malaysia lng plant , a shell middle distillate synthesis plant , and a bintulu combined cycle power plant . [SEP]
[CLS] the economy has also expanded into oil palm and forest plantations , palm oil processing , wood @ - @ waste processing , and cement manufacturing . [SEP] the port of bintulu is the busiest in sarawak . [SEP]
[CLS] the town is also a gateway to samalajau industrial park . [SEP] among the tourist attractions in bintulu are similajau national park , tumbina park , tanjung batu beach , jepak village , kuan yin tong temple , assyakirin mosque , council negri monument , tamu bintulu , and pasar utama markets . [SEP]
[CLS] the borneo international kite festival is held annually in the town . [SEP] during the 16th century , bintulu was named " river de burulu " by portuguese cartographers . [SEP]
[CLS] there are several legends surrounding the name bintulu . [SEP] during the brooke dynasty , the indigenous iban people practised headhunting to maintain their social status in the community . [SEP]
[CLS] they threw the heads into the kemena river , after which the heads had to be collected from the river . [SEP] the practice of collecting the heads was known as " mentu ulau " ( picking heads ) in the local native language . [SEP]
[CLS] another story relates that two iban warriors named bernik and jelab built houses along the river . [SEP] they and their followers frequently carried out preservation of severed heads near a small river stream branching off from sebezaw river because the river bank was flat and wide . [SEP]
[CLS] therefore , the small river stream was named " mentu ulau " river . [SEP] outsiders who came to bintulu subsequently pronounced the name as " mentulau " , and later the name evolved into " bentulu " and , finally , " bintulu " . [SEP]
[CLS] james brooke was appointed the white rajah of sarawak ( now known as kuching ) by the bruneian empire in 1841 . [SEP] in 1861 , the sultanate of brunei ceded the bintulu region to brooke . [SEP]
[CLS] bintulu was a small settlement at that time . [SEP] a wooden fort named fort keppel was built in the village , named after sir henry keppel , who was a close friend of the rajah james and charles brooke . [SEP]
[CLS] sir henry keppel was responsible for crushing the dayak piracy in the saribas between 1840 and 1850 . [SEP] meanwhile , charles brooke was a nephew of james brooke and would later become the latter ' s successor as the second rajah of sarawak . [SEP]
[CLS] odoardo beccari , an italian botanist , visited bintulu in 1867 . [SEP] on 4 august , he started his journey on a gunboat named " heartsease " , which was to send $ 6 @ , @ 000 to brunei for concessions being made to james brooke in the mukah and bintulu regions . [SEP]
[CLS] he went to labuan before coming back to bintulu . [SEP] he dropped off at kemena river on 13 august 1867 . [SEP]
[CLS] his observations of the village were recorded as follows : [SEP] the fort of bintulu which was built entirely of wood , was in somewhat ruinous condition . [SEP]
[CLS] it stood nearly on the sea @ - @ shore , and just behind it , at a distance of few paces , the primeval forests commenced . . . [SEP] some chinamen had settled at the vicinity of the fort and had built a small bazaar ; but the village is chiefly formed by the houses of the melanau beyond the chinese kampong ( village ) . [SEP]
[CLS] these melanaus used to live further up the river , but since the construction of the fort , and the installation of an officer of the rajah near the mouth of the river , they came to settle near the sea – a thing they would never have dared to do in former days for fear of the attacks of the lanun pirates and dayak pirates . [SEP] the houses of the melanau people were built in rows on both sides of the kemena river , mostly furnished by nipah and sago palms . [SEP]
[CLS] each house had its own shed projection into the entrance of the river , which was used for the processing of sago palms . [SEP] on 8 september 1867 , the first sarawak general council meeting ( now sarawak state legislative assembly ) took place here . [SEP]
[CLS] it was made up of 21 elected local community members ( five british officers and 16 malay and melanau local chiefs ) . [SEP] the council was formed by raja muda charles brooke under orders from rajah james brooke . [SEP]
[CLS] the council is the oldest state legislative assembly in malaysia . [SEP] during world war ii , rajah charles vyner brooke ordered the construction of airstrips in kuching , oya , mukah , bintulu , and miri . [SEP]
[CLS] construction of the bintulu airstrip was started in 1934 under the direction of c . w . bailey , a works and building inspector for the british royal air force ( raf ) . [SEP] all the airstrips were completed except for the bintulu airstrip , where construction was discontinued in october 1938 due to financial reasons . [SEP]
[CLS] japanese forces landed in miri on 16 december 1941 . [SEP] sarawak fell into japanese hands when they conquered kuching on 24 december 1941 . [SEP]
[CLS] when the japanese invaded sarawak , charles vyner brooke already left for sydney ( australia ) before the attack while his officers were captured by the japanese and interned at the batu lintang camp . [SEP] during the japanese occupation , the japanese used the airstrip for military purposes . [SEP]
[CLS] however , the airstrip was heavily bombed by allied forces . [SEP] the british began reconstruction of the airstrip after the war ; during the project many unexploded bombs were unearthed . [SEP]
[CLS] on 5 september 1942 , japanese field marshal prince maida ( 前 田 [UNK] [UNK] ) boarded a plane from kuching to labuan to officiate an airport that bears his name . [SEP] however , he never arrived . [SEP]
[CLS] one month later , the plane was found to have crashed off the coast of tanjung datu , bintulu . [SEP] the cause of the plane crash was not known . [SEP]
[CLS] the japanese later set up a wooden pole memorial made up of belian wood in bintulu . [SEP] the wooden pole was later taken back to japan by the family of prince maida . [SEP]
[CLS] chinese sawmill owners at sibu and bintulu were instructed by the japanese to produce timber for repairs at oil fields and ship building . [SEP] during the japanese occupation , sawmills at bintulu produced a total of 4 @ , @ 000 tons of sawn timber . [SEP]
[CLS] in the 1950s , major economic activities in bintulu were the timber extraction industry , fishing , and sago processing . [SEP] in the 1960s , bintulu was still a small fishing village , with a population of 5 @ , @ 000 . [SEP]
[CLS] no roads were constructed in bintulu until 1969 when the first untarred road was built to connect bintulu to miri . [SEP] the first bus that serviced the miri – bintulu route was owned by majlis amanah rakyat ( mara ) . [SEP]
[CLS] the mara bus line was an initiative by the malaysian federal government to provide public transportation for the people . [SEP] the iban villagers paid the bus driver with " vegetables , chickens , bamboo shoots , and other items " . [SEP]
[CLS] before 1960 , bintulu was connected to kuching by sea through a ship named " swee joo " . [SEP] after 1960 , the ship " chin chin " was added to the route . [SEP]
[CLS] it took around 36 to 48 hours to reach bintulu from kuching , depending on the sea conditions . [SEP] due to lack of food supplies from kuching , the villagers had to make do with limited food , and several villagers resorted to hunting in the jungles to supplement the food supply . [SEP]
[CLS] in 1960 there were only three primary schools in bintulu . [SEP] these schools provided classes until primary 3 level . [SEP]
[CLS] there were no secondary schools . [SEP] villagers could pursue their secondary school studies at either miri or kuching by using small boats as there were no roads connecting bintulu to either miri or kuching . [SEP]
[CLS] bintulu government secondary school was opened in 1964 . [SEP] in 1967 bintulu celebrated the first 100 years of the council negri meeting ( sarawak state legislative assembly ) . [SEP]
[CLS] a stone monument was built in front of a government rice storeroom to commemorate the event . [SEP] bintulu was a sub @ - @ district of miri division in the 1970s . [SEP]
[CLS] the sub @ - @ district was upgraded into a district in 1987 . [SEP] large reserves of natural gas were discovered off the coast of bintulu in 1969 . [SEP]
[CLS] following this , a feasibility study was done in 1975 , and tanjung kidurong was found to be a suitable site for a deep @ - @ water port . [SEP] on 14 june 1978 , malaysia lng sdn bhd ( mlng satu ) was established by petronas , a malaysian national oil and gas company for liquefied natural gas ( lng ) processing at bintulu . [SEP]
[CLS] on 8 july 1978 , the bintulu development authority ( bda ) was established by the sarawak state government for infrastructure development and to promote industrial investment in the area . [SEP] on 15 august 1981 , the bintulu port authority was established at tanjung kidurong , starting operation on 1 january 1983 . [SEP]
[CLS] since the establishment of sarawak corridor of renewable energy ( score ) in 2008 , bintulu become the gateway to samalajau industrial park , which is located 62 kilometres ( 39 mi ) away from bintulu . [SEP] the industrial park is a centre of heavy , energy @ - @ intensive industry . [SEP]
[CLS] among the companies that started their operations in the industrial park are tokuyama malaysia sdn bhd , press metal bintulu sdn bhd , and om materials sdn bhd . [SEP] rural – urban migration is significant in bintulu because of greater job availability in the town . [SEP]
[CLS] since 2007 , new residents have started several squatter areas in bintulu due to inability to find affordable housing , around kidurong industrial estate and sungai sebatang . [SEP] to address the issue , several low @ - @ cost housing projects were initiated by bda and sarawak state government to relocate the squatters . [SEP]
[CLS] the state government planned to achieve zero squatters status by the year 2020 . [SEP] bintulu also saw the rise in the number of residential and commercial properties such as double @ - @ storeyed terraced houses , terraced shopoffices , kidurong commercial centre , and time square shopping mall . [SEP]
[CLS] residential properties has shown a 20 % price increase from 2011 to 2013 . [SEP] bintulu is represented by bintulu parliamentary seat ( p . 217 ) in the parliament of malaysia . [SEP]
[CLS] the town is also represented by three state assembly seats – jepak , kidurong ( later was split by two state assembly namely tanjung batu and samalaju ) , and kemena – in the sarawak state legislative assembly . [SEP] since 1978 the town of bintulu has been administered by the bintulu development authority ( bda ) , with offices located along jalan tanjung kidurong . [SEP]
[CLS] the town is located within the boundary of bintulu district , with a population of 183 @ , @ 402 and a total area of 7 @ , @ 220 @ . @ 40 square kilometres ( 2 @ , @ 787 @ . @ 81 sq mi ) . [SEP] bintulu division was formerly a bintulu district under the jurisdiction of miri division . [SEP]
[CLS] the former bintulu district was upgraded to bintulu division on 1 january 1987 . [SEP] at the same time , bintulu sub @ - @ district was upgraded to the present @ - @ day bintulu district . [SEP]
[CLS] both the bintulu resident and district offices are located inside wisma residen , pisang keling street , bintulu . [SEP] bintulu is located 610 kilometres ( 380 mi ) northeast of kuching 216 kilometres ( 134 mi ) northeast of sibu , and 200 kilometres ( 120 mi ) southwest of miri . [SEP]
[CLS] bintulu is located near the mouth of the kemena river , in the coastal region of central sarawak . [SEP] geology of the coastal area was formed during the pleistocene period ; silt , clay , and gravel can be found here . [SEP]
[CLS] geological formation from the oligocene period is found in the inland area , which contains limestone , siltstone , and sandstone . [SEP] the soil is generally soft . [SEP]
[CLS] there are two monsoon seasons in the bintulu : the northeast moonsoon ( november to march ) and the southwest moonsoon ( may to september ) . [SEP] the calm period between these two moonsoons is known as the transitional period . [SEP]
[CLS] in the coastal region , maximum rainfall occurs in the month of january , while minimal rainfall occurs from the period june to august . [SEP] rainfall is more evenly distributed in the inland areas . [SEP]
[CLS] the annual rainfall of the bintulu region is about 3 @ , @ 750 mm ( 148 in ) annually . [SEP] the mean daily hours of sunshine at bintulu is about 5 @ . @ 0 to 5 @ . @ 5 hours . [SEP]
[CLS] bintulu receives on average 14 to 15 mj / m2 of radiation throughout the year . [SEP] bintulu ' s relative humidity is 85 % . [SEP]
[CLS] the growth of bintulu ' s population is shown below : the issue of gangsters in bintulu was first raised in 2007 by the member of parliament ( mp ) for bintulu . [SEP] the gangsters may have run businesses related to illegal logging , controlling the prices of diesel , eggs , fertiliser and gas cylinders . [SEP]
[CLS] bintulu police have been cracking down on gangster activities in the town . [SEP] unscrupulous businessmen who seek cheap labour have caused a rise in the number of illegal immigrants in bintulu . [SEP]
[CLS] the number may have reached 50 @ , @ 000 in 2009 . [SEP] bintulu immigration department has performed several operations to deport illegal immigrants back to their home country . [SEP]
[CLS] as of the 2010 malaysian census , the population of the town of bintulu is 114 @ , @ 058 . [SEP] indigenous people accounted for the largest proportion of the town population ( 61 @ . @ 2 % , 69 @ , @ 782 ) , followed by chinese ( 25 @ . @ 0 % , 28 @ , @ 512 ) , non @ - @ malaysians ( 13 @ . @ 1 % , 14 @ , @ 939 ) , and indians ( 0 @ . @ 28 % , 319 ) . [SEP]
[CLS] among the indigenous groups , there are iban ( 32 @ , @ 992 ) , malay ( 14 @ , @ 945 ) , melanau ( 14 @ , @ 179 ) , bidayuh ( 1 @ , @ 598 ) , and other indigenous tribes ( 6 @ , @ 068 ) . [SEP] according to government sources , there are 229 iban longhouses in the bintulu district . [SEP]
[CLS] the ibans moved into kemena and tatau basins in the mid @ - @ 19th and early 20th century with permission of the brooke government . [SEP] other indigenous tribes that form the minority are kayan , kenyah , and punan . [SEP]
[CLS] the chinese in bintulu are mainly composed of dialect groups such as hakka , fuzhou , and teochews . [SEP] the chinese have been living in the town of tatau since the era of bruneian empire . [SEP]
[CLS] later , fuzhou chinese from sibu moved in , dominating the timber and plantation businesses in bintulu . [SEP] there is also a large number of foreigners working there . [SEP]
[CLS] most of them come from britain , australia , the netherlands , germany , south africa , new zealand , japan , china , the united states , and indonesia . [SEP] while malay is the official language of sarawak ; english is widely spoken there . [SEP]
[CLS] local ethnic languages and chinese dialects are spoken by the respective ethnic groups . [SEP] standard chinese is also spoken by ethnic chinese in bintulu . [SEP]
[CLS] bintulu is spoken by communities living along the kemena river , with 4 @ , @ 200 native speakers . [SEP] these speakers are now recognised as part of the melanau ethnic group , where their main language is malay . [SEP]
[CLS] bintulu is classified as one of the endangered languages in sarawak because of the isolated usage of the language in a small community . [SEP] the majority of the bintulu population are adherents of christian denominations due to christian missionaries operating during the brooke dynasty ; followed by islam , buddhism , and hinduism . [SEP]
[CLS] among the notable places of worship in bintulu are the bintulu mosque ( masjid assyakirin ) , masjid jepak , tua pek kong temple , eng kwang methodist church , and st . thomas church . [SEP] the respective religious groups are free to hold processions in the town . [SEP]
[CLS] there are five industrial estates in bintulu . [SEP] they are : kemena industrial estate ( for wood @ - @ based industries ) , jepak industries estate ( wood @ - @ based industries ) , kidurong industrial area ( for medium and light industries ) , kidurong light industrial estate ( medium and light industries ) , and bintulu light industrial estate ( light industry ) . [SEP]
[CLS] malaysia lng is a liquefied natural gas ( lng ) manufacturing complex located in bintulu that currently contains eight lng trains with a ninth one currently under construction . [SEP] the complex was built by the malaysian national oil and gas company , petronas . [SEP]
[CLS] the manufacturing complex has a production capacity of 25 @ . @ 7 million tonnes per annum . [SEP] petronas is also planning to open floating lng ( flng ) offshore bintulu , which is used specifically to harvest natural gas from small and isolated gas fields . [SEP]
[CLS] transportation of natural gas from the neighouring state of kimanis , sabah , to the lng complex at bintulu is facilitated by a 512 @ - @ kilometre ( 318 mi ) pipeline known as the " sabah sarawak gas pipeline " . [SEP] currently , 45 % of malaysian natural gas is found at central luconia off the coast of bintulu . [SEP]
[CLS] the largest importers of malaysia lng productions are japan ( 62 % ) , korea ( 17 % ) , taiwan ( 12 % ) , and china ( 9 % ) . [SEP] the sarawak shell bintulu plant ( ssbp ) , formerly known as bintulu crude oil terminal ( bcot ) , was established in 1979 . [SEP]
[CLS] it consists of three crude oil storage tanks , each with a capacity of 410 @ , @ 000 barrels . [SEP] it has three major areas of operation : crude oil operations , condensate stabilisation , and gas sales facilities . [SEP]
[CLS] royal dutch shell started to establish the world ' s first shell middle distillate synthesis plant ( shell mds ) in 1993 . [SEP] it is also known as bintulu gas @ - @ to @ - @ liquid plant ( bintulu gtl ) . [SEP]
[CLS] the plant has a production capacity of 14 @ , @ 770 barrels per day with a total investment of over us $ 1 billion as of the year 2010 . [SEP] the plant is staffed with 380 people , of whom 93 % are malaysians , with 80 % of the staff coming from sarawak . [SEP]
[CLS] since the opening up of the bintulu – miri road in the 1970s , large @ - @ scale plantations of oil palm and cocoa has been developed in rural areas of bintulu division . [SEP] currently , there are 57 @ , @ 740 hectares ( 577 @ . @ 4 km2 ( 223 sq mi ) ) of oil palm , 2 @ , @ 000 hectares ( 200 km2 ( 77 sq mi ) ) of rattan , and 815 hectares ( 8 @ . @ 15 km2 ( 3 sq mi ) ) of pepper plantations . [SEP]
[CLS] the first bintulu palm oil refinery , bintulu edible oil sdn bhd , was established in june 1991 . [SEP] bintulu currently has four palm oil refineries : bintulu edible oils sdn bhd ( operated under pgeo group , a subsidiary of wilmar international ) , [SEP]
[CLS] sime darby austral edible oil sdn bhd , kirana palm oil refinery sdn bhd , and sarawak oil palm bhd . [SEP] however , as of 2015 , wilmar no longer buys raw palm oil produced from cleared forests and peat swamps in sarawak because of environmental concerns . [SEP]
[CLS] the bintulu division has been designated as a planted forests zone ( pfz ) by the sarawak state government since 1998 . [SEP] as of 30 june 2011 , a total of 124 @ , @ 618 hectares ( 1 @ , @ 246 @ . @ 18 km2 ( 481 sq mi ) ) has been planted with acacia trees . [SEP]
[CLS] other trees that are planned for plantations are kelampayan , engkabang , durian , batai , eucalyptus , and rubber trees . [SEP] sarawak planted forest sdn bhd , a company wholly owned by the sarawak state government , has been granted a license to replant forests for 60 years . [SEP]
[CLS] however , the company has been suffering financial losses from 2009 to 2011 . [SEP] there are three mills in bintulu that process wood @ - @ waste products . [SEP]
[CLS] two are medium @ - @ density fibreboard ( mdf ) plants and the third is a charcoal briquette plant , with a total installed capacity of 246 @ , @ 000 cubic metres ( 8 @ , @ 700 @ , @ 000 cu ft ) per year . [SEP] mdf plants utilise wood waste purchased from sawmills and plywood mills in the bintulu area and occasionally from the tanjung manis timber processing zone located at the mouth of the rajang river . [SEP]
[CLS] synthetic resins , which are required to hold wood dust together , constituted 20 % of the total production cost of the wood panel products . [SEP] mdf plants in bintulu are operated by daiken sarawak sdn bhd , which was founded on 15 february 1994 . [SEP]
[CLS] the briquette plant is operated by cipta briquette sdn bhd . [SEP] a glue / adhesive factory in bintulu is owned by bintulu adhesive & chemicals sdn bhd . [SEP]
[CLS] it produces urea formaldehyde resin and phenol formaldehyde resin for plywood and chipboard manufacturing at kemena industrial estate . [SEP] urea precondensate is also produced to supply asean bintulu fertiliser ( abf ) plant . [SEP]
[CLS] the bintulu port authority was established in 1981 . [SEP] it started port operation in 1983 at tanjung kidurong . [SEP]
[CLS] following a privatisation exercise , bintulu port sdn bhd ( bpsb ) was founded on 23 december 1992 and commenced operation on 1 january 1993 . [SEP] bpa is currently responsible for regulatory exercises and security of the port . [SEP]
[CLS] meanwhile , bpsb is responsible for cargo handling at the bintulu international container terminal ( bict ) . [SEP] the port also provides vessel traffic service to shipping vessels . [SEP]
[CLS] the annual total cargo throughput is 45 @ . @ 4 million tonnes , consisting of 58 % lng and 42 % non @ - @ lng products . [SEP] as of 31 december 2014 , it generated a total revenue of rm 552 @ . @ 3 million per year . [SEP]
[CLS] bintulu port is the busiest port in sarawak . [SEP] the asean bintulu fertiliser plant is the anhydrous ammonia and granular plant operated by asean bintulu fertiliser sdn bhd ( abf ) , which is partly owned by petronas . [SEP]
[CLS] the company was formed on 6 december 1980 . [SEP] the plant started operation on 1 october 1985 . [SEP]
[CLS] it is also one of the largest granular urea plants in asia . [SEP] it is a joint venture by five asean countries : malaysia ( 63 @ . @ 5 % shares ) , thailand ( 13 % ) , indonesia ( 13 % ) , the philippines ( 9 @ . @ 5 % ) , and singapore ( 1 % ) . [SEP]
[CLS] cahya mata sarawak berhad ( cmsb ) , one of the largest publicly traded companies in sarawak , set up a cement plant in bintulu at kidurong industrial estate . [SEP] the plant , manned by 40 people , produces ordinary portland cement and portland blast furnace cement . [SEP]
[CLS] it currently has a combined production capacity of 2 @ . @ 75 million mt ( million tonnes ) . [SEP] the bintulu combined cycle power plant was started in early 2010 with a capacity of 317 megawatts . [SEP]
[CLS] the power plant is registered under the united nations clean development management ( cdm ) scheme as of 18 september 2010 . [SEP] the plant is built to ensure efficient use of energy and reduce green house gas emissions . [SEP]
[CLS] it is the first cdm power plant in malaysia , currently operated by sarawak power generation sdn bhd ( spg ) , a wholly owned subsidiary of sarawak energy . [SEP] all roads in bintulu are maintained by the bintulu development authority ( bda ) . [SEP]
[CLS] bintulu is connected to miri and sibu by the pan borneo highway . [SEP] bintulu is also connected to mukah and samalaju industrial park . [SEP]
[CLS] kemena bridge crosses the kemena river . [SEP] it is the second bridge in malaysia built using the incremental launch method . [SEP]
[CLS] keppel road in bintulu is named after a friend of james brooke , sir henry keppel . [SEP] bintulu has a long @ - @ distance bus station , located at medan jaya , 5 km ( 3 mi ) northeast of the town centre . [SEP]
[CLS] among the areas served by the bus station are : miri , sibu , kuching , mukah , sarikei , oya , dalat , balingian , and pontianak , indonesia . [SEP] the bus companies that serve the station are the syarikat baram sdn . [SEP]
[CLS] bhd , mtc , biaramas , and suria bus lines . [SEP] there are also buses that serve the town area . [SEP]
[CLS] taxi service is also available . [SEP] the old bintulu airport was built in 1955 in the town centre . [SEP]
[CLS] it once held the guinness world record of nearest airport to town . [SEP] on 19 december 2002 , the airport was replaced by a new airport , which is located 23 km ( 14 mi ) away from the town centre . [SEP]
[CLS] the surroundings of the old airport were developed into commercial and residential projects while the runaway is reserved for bintulu international kite festival . [SEP] the new airport has a runway measuring 2 @ , @ 745 m ( 9 @ , @ 006 ft ) , capable of handling planes as large as the airbus a330 . [SEP]
[CLS] the airport currently serves three major airlines : malaysia airlines ( mas ) , air asia , and maswings , connecting to domestic destinations such as : sibu , miri , kuching , kuala lumpur , and kota kinabalu . [SEP] there is a wharf terminal at bintulu that serves the rural areas of bintulu division . [SEP]
[CLS] among the destinations that can be reached by express boat from bintulu are : sebauh , pandan , labang , tubau , and binyo . [SEP] the current court complex is located at pisang emas road . [SEP]
[CLS] it comprises the high court , the sessions court , and the magistrate court . [SEP] bintulu also has syariah subordinate court , located at tanjung kidurong , whose area of jurisdiction covers bintulu district and tatau districts . [SEP]
[CLS] the bintulu central police station is located at tun hussein onn road , with other police stations located at tanjung kidurong , tubau , and sebauh . [SEP] there is also a central prison in bintulu , which doubles as a correctional centre . [SEP]
[CLS] bintulu hospital started operation in 1968 . [SEP] it is located at nyabau road , 12 km ( 7 @ . @ 5 mi ) from the town centre . [SEP]
[CLS] following renovations completed on 21 may 2000 , the hospital is now equipped with 200 beds . [SEP] as of 2011 , the hospital provides speciality services in seven medical disciplines . [SEP]
[CLS] bintulu also has one polyclinic , polyclinic bintulu . [SEP] there are two private hospitals in bintulu : columbia asia hospital and bintulu medical centre . [SEP]
[CLS] there are about 50 primary and eight secondary schools in bintulu . [SEP] all the schools under the national education system are managed by the bintulu district education office . [SEP]
[CLS] the oldest primary schools in miri are st anthony ' s primary school ( roman catholic mission school ) , chung hua primary school , and the orang kaya mohammad primary school , which were established in the early 1960s . [SEP] the bintulu government secondary school was built in 1964 . [SEP]
[CLS] it is now known as smk bintulu , the oldest secondary school in the town . [SEP] bintulu also has one chinese independent school , kai dee middle school ( [UNK] 智 中 学 ) . [SEP]
[CLS] the shell oil company established the kidurong international school in 1982 to meet the primary education needs of shell employees ' children . [SEP] the school provides english national curriculum ( enc ) for literacy and numeracy and international primary curriculum ( ipc ) for other subjects . [SEP]
[CLS] upm bintulu sarawak campus was started as the national resource training centre , kuching , in 1974 . [SEP] the oldest campus in sarawak , it was relocated to bintulu in 1987 as a branch campus of the universiti pertanian malaysia ( upm ) . [SEP]
[CLS] the campus was closed down in 1992 before reopening in 2001 as universiti putra malaysia ( upm ) . [SEP] during this period of closure , the campus was used as the site for maktab perguruan sains bintulu ( bintulu science teachers ' training college ) from 1994 to july 1999 when it was moved to kota samarahan as institut pendidikan guru kampus tun abdul razak ( tun abdul razak teachers ' training institute campus ) . [SEP]
[CLS] the upm campus is currently located 13 km ( 8 mi ) away from the town centre , occupying 715 ha ( 1 @ , @ 767 acres ) , which can accommodate up to 2 @ , @ 200 students . [SEP] this branch campus currently has only one faculty , the faculty of agriculture and food sciences , consisting of five academic departments . [SEP]
[CLS] in 2015 upm was ranked 41st in the ui @ - @ greenmetric world university rankings . [SEP] sedamai college , established in november 1999 , offers courses in business , information technology , language , and engineering . [SEP]
[CLS] there is also a technical school located 15 km ( 9 mi ) away from the town , near tanjung kidurong , occupying 20 ha ( 49 acres ) of land . [SEP] the school was built in 1982 with a maximum capacity of 900 students . [SEP]
[CLS] among the courses offered are : automotive , mechanical and civil engineering , commerce , and fashion . [SEP] gulf golden international flying academy ( ggifa ) , the first and only flying academy in sarawak , was closed in 2012 due to financial difficulties . [SEP]
[CLS] the first public library in bintulu was built in 1971 by bintulu district council ( bdc ) . [SEP] in 1988 the library was demolished to make way for car parks . [SEP]
[CLS] books from the library were moved into the former bdc building . [SEP] on 29 may 2000 , the bintulu development authority ( bda ) public library was built near the bintulu civic centre , which is 2 km ( 1 @ . @ 2 mi ) from the town . [SEP]
[CLS] the public library has three branches : at kidurong , tatau , and sebauh . [SEP] kampung jepak ( jepak village ) is a melanau fishing village in bintulu located near kemena river . [SEP]
[CLS] among the daily activities in this village are sago processing , fish drying , and the manufacturing of belacan , cencaluk ( salted shrimp ) , terendak ( melanau headgear ) , and tutop ( a type of food cover ) . [SEP] kuan yin tong temple is located at km2 jalan sultan iskandar . [SEP]
[CLS] it has a structural design with a rock garden courtyard , man @ - @ made waterfall , and dragon fencing . [SEP] assyakirin mosque , meaning " gratefulness to god " , has a man @ - @ made waterfall , a fountain , and a landscape planted with flowers . [SEP]
[CLS] the borneo international kite festival has been held yearly since 2005 at the old bintulu airport runway . [SEP] it usually lasts for four to five days in september . [SEP]
[CLS] in 1987 a clock tower and a fountain were erected at council negri monument . [SEP] a centenary stone that was erected in 1967 to commemorate the event is kept under the clock tower . [SEP]
[CLS] the bintulu tua pek kong temple ( near tamu bintulu ) is believed to have been built in the 1890s to purge the town from evil spirits . [SEP] the temple survived world war ii , and was rebuilt after the discovery of oil and gas reserves offshore . [SEP]
[CLS] similajau national park is located 30 km ( 19 mi ) northeast of the town . [SEP] the park was gazetted in 1976 , covering an area of 8 @ , @ 996 ha ( 22 @ , @ 230 acres ) [SEP]
[CLS] ( 89 @ . @ 96 km2 ( 35 sq mi ) with sandy beaches , rocky headlands , jungle streams , and forests . [SEP] other national parks that can be accessed along the miri – bintulu road are the lambir hills national park and niah national park . [SEP]
[CLS] tanjung batu beach ( temasya beach ) is located 3 km ( 1 @ . @ 9 mi ) from the town centre . [SEP] meanwhile , taman tumbina ( tumbina park ) is located 4 km ( 2 @ . @ 5 mi ) from the town centre . [SEP]
[CLS] the park has a hornbill aviary , a butterfly garden , and a mini @ - @ zoo . [SEP] kidurong tower is an observation tower located at tanjung kidurong . [SEP]
[CLS] it offers a view of the bintulu oil and gas facilities shortly after nightfall . [SEP] bintulu promenade is a 3 @ - @ kilometre ( 2 mi ) walkway along the bintulu coastline with the kemena river mouth as its focal point . [SEP]
[CLS] it has the observation points offering sunset views . [SEP] there is also an 18 @ - @ hole golf course at bintulu . [SEP]
[CLS] there are several shopping malls in bintulu : parkcity mall , city point , ngiu kee departmental stores , farley shopping complex , sing kwong supermarkets , and mds @ - @ mart . [SEP] time square mall is currently under development in bintulu , with everrise as the anchor tenant . [SEP]
[CLS] tamu bintulu and pasar utama are the two main markets in the town . [SEP] both places have a unique cone @ - @ shaped roof that symbolises the traditional melanau headgear named terendak . [SEP]
[CLS] tamu bintulu offers items ranging from jungle produce to native home @ - @ made specialties such as belacan . [SEP] meanwhile , pasar utama houses both wet market and dry market under one roof , providing fresh vegetables , fruits , fish , and dairy products . [SEP]
[CLS] the first floor of pasar utama offers a variety of fast food such as laksa , kolok mee , jawa mee , pulut panggang , ais batu campur , cendol , and teh tarik . [SEP] the bintulu night market is located on kampung dagang road . [SEP]
[CLS] there are over 150 stalls selling a variety of items such as garments , electric goods , vegetables , fruits , food and drinks . [SEP] the zrinski battalion ( croatian : bojna zrinski ) was a special forces unit of the croatian national guard ( zbor narodne garde – zng ) and later of the croatian army ( hrvatska vojska – hv ) established in kumrovec on 18 may 1991 , during the croatian war of independence . [SEP]
[CLS] the unit drew personnel from the special police forces and a former french foreign legion troops serving as its core . [SEP] the battalion was set up and initially commanded by ante roso , while major miljenko filipovic took over as the commanding officer in august . [SEP]
[CLS] the zrinski battalion trained volunteer troops in vukovar in june 1991 before it saw action in hrvatska kostajnica , the battle of gospic and near slano in 1991 . [SEP] by the end of 1991 , the unit ' s personnel were tasked with setting up an additional special forces unit of the hv . [SEP]
[CLS] the next year its elements took part in the battle of kupres and operation tiger aimed at lifting the siege of dubrovnik . [SEP] it also and helped develop and train the croatian defence council ( hrvatsko vijece obrane – hvo ) , setting up a training camp in tomislavgrad . [SEP]
[CLS] in 1993 , the battalion took part in operation maslenica . [SEP] in february 1994 , the zrinski battalion was amalgamated with several other hv special forces units into the 1st croatian guards brigade ( 1 @ . @ hrvatski gardijski zdrug ) , a component of the 1st croatian guards corps ( 1 @ . @ hrvatski gardijski zbor ) . [SEP]
[CLS] in 1990 , following the electoral defeat of the government of the socialist republic of croatia , ethnic tensions between croats and croatian serbs worsened . [SEP] the yugoslav people ' s army ( jugoslavenska narodna armija – jna ) believed croatia would use the croatian territorial defence force ' s ( teritorijalna obrana – to ) equipment to build its own army and confront the jna itself . [SEP]
[CLS] in order to minimize the expected resistance , the jna confiscated the to weapons . [SEP] on 17 august , the tensions escalated into an open revolt of the croatian serbs . [SEP]
[CLS] in the beginning of 1991 , croatia had no regular army . [SEP] in an effort to bolster its defence , croatia doubled the size of its police force to about 20 @ , @ 000 . [SEP]
[CLS] the most effective part of the force was the 3 @ , @ 000 @ - @ strong special police that were deployed in 12 battalions , adopting military organisation . [SEP] in addition there were 9 @ , @ 000 – 10 @ , @ 000 regionally organised reserve police . [SEP]
[CLS] the reserve police were set up in 16 battalions and 10 companies , but they lacked weapons needed to arm many of the troops . [SEP] preparations to set up the croatian national guard ( zbor narodne garde – zng ) began on 12 april 1991 . [SEP]
[CLS] establishment of the zng as a police force with military capabilities was thought necessary by the croatian authorities following armed clashes in pakrac and at plitvice lakes in march and due to the possibility of further confrontation with the jna . [SEP] the zng , formally established on 23 april , was tasked with protection of the constitutional order , maintenance of public order , anti @ - @ terrorist operations , protection of croatia ' s borders , territory , coast and territorial waters , as well as the protection of high @ - @ value structures and high @ - @ profile persons . [SEP]
[CLS] on 18 may 1991 , the zrinski battalion was established as a special forces unit of the zng . [SEP] the core of the unit consisted of 27 volunteers drawn from the kumrovec special police unit ( spu ) . [SEP]
[CLS] initially , it relied on former french foreign legion troops . [SEP] the most senior among the former legionnaires was ante roso , previously a sous @ - @ officier ( non @ - @ commissioned officer – nco ) in the 4th foreign regiment . [SEP]
[CLS] in consequence , roso was tasked with setting up the unit as its initial commander . [SEP] major miljenko filipovic , likewise a former french foreign legion member , was assigned the battalions deputy commander . [SEP]
[CLS] the unit was based in the village of kumrovec in the region of hrvatsko zagorje , on the grounds of the former " josip broz tito " political school . [SEP] the site , adjacent to the border of slovenia , was selected to be inaccessible to yugoslav air force raids without violation of slovene or possibly austrian airspace . [SEP]
[CLS] in june 1991 , the kumrovec spu was transferred to sljeme peak north of zagreb leaving kumrovec base to the zrinski battalion , as well as the second special forces unit , the frankopan battalion . [SEP] the zrinski battalion was deployed for the first time on 15 june . [SEP]
[CLS] it was stationed in vukovar , tasked with preparation of city defences and organisation of volunteer troops . [SEP] in august , filipovic took over command of the battalion from roso . [SEP]
[CLS] the same month , the zrinski battalion was deployed to the banovina , where it pushed the croatian serb forces out of the town of hrvatska kostajnica . [SEP] in september , the battalion was deployed to gospic , where it took part in battle to control gospic against the jna . [SEP]
[CLS] troops assigned to the battalion captured kaniza barracks in gospic . [SEP] during combat in gospic , 30 troops of the zrinski battalion , assisted by lucko spu , captured jna major general trajce krstevski , along with three armoured personnel carriers ( apcs ) and 32 soldiers . [SEP]
[CLS] the unit was deployed to metkovic on 28 october , tasked with recapturing slano from the jna . [SEP] after the deployment to gospic , a part of the unit personnel left to bosnia and herzegovina anticipating further conflict there , while the remainder of the unit returned to kumrovec . [SEP]
[CLS] the zng was renamed the croatian army ( hrvatska vojska – hv ) on 3 november 1991 . [SEP] in late 1991 , personnel of the zrinski battalion set up another special forces unit of the hv — the matija vlacic battalion based in opatija . [SEP]
[CLS] in 1992 , elements of the zrinski battalion took part in the battle of kupres , before setting up a training camp in the town of tomislavgrad . [SEP] there the battalion personnel assisted in setting up and trained the croatian defence council ( hrvatsko vijece obrane – hvo ) . [SEP]
[CLS] later that year , elements of the battalion took part in operation tiger — aimed at lifting of the siege of dubrovnik . [SEP] in 1993 , elements of the zrinski battalion took part in operation maslenica , fighting in the area of skabrnja . [SEP]
[CLS] the central intelligence agency assessed the zrinski battalion as one of the best units of the hv . [SEP] on 25 february 1994 , the zrinski battalion was amalgamated with parts of other special forces units of the hv : frankopan battalion , ban jelacic battalion , matija vlacic battalion , ferdo sucic battalion and part of 8th light assault brigade forming the 1st croatian guards brigade ( 1 @ . @ hrvatski gardijski zdrug ) , a component of the 1st croatian guards corps ( 1 @ . @ hrvatski gardijski zbor ) , directly subordinated to the ministry of defence rather than the general staff of the armed forces of the republic of croatia . [CLS] " weevils wobble [SEP] but they don ' t go down " is the nineteenth and penultimate episode of the third season of the american mystery television series veronica mars , and the 63rd episode overall . [SEP]
[CLS] written by phil klemmer and directed by jason bloom , the episode premiered on the cw on may 22 , 2007 . [SEP] the series depicts the adventures of veronica mars ( kristen bell ) as she deals with life as a college student while moonlighting as a private detective . [SEP]
[CLS] in this episode , weevil ( francis capra ) enlists veronica ' s help in proving his innocence when he is implicated in creating fake student ids . [SEP] meanwhile , veronica and piz ( chris lowell ) come to terms with veronica ' s fbi internship , and a sex tape of this couple is released on the internet . [SEP]
[CLS] logan ( jason dohring ) beats up piz , thinking that he posted it . [SEP] in addition , keith ( enrico colantoni ) and vinnie ( ken marino ) debate on piz ' s radio show about the upcoming sheriff ' s election in which they are running against each other . [SEP]
[CLS] " weevils wobble [SEP] but they don ' t go down " features the reappearance of weevil after an absence of five episodes ; during filming of the third season , capra was undergoing medical treatment . [SEP]
[CLS] series creator rob thomas pointed out logan and piz ' s fight scene as one of the highlights of the episode and the season . [SEP] in its original broadcast , the episode received mostly positive reviews from television critics , with many praising the case @ - @ of @ - @ the @ - @ week . [SEP]
[CLS] in a checkout line , veronica and mac ( tina majorino ) discuss her relationship with piz and what her fbi internship will mean for them . [SEP] they then see someone getting arrested by the campus police for a fake debit card . [SEP]
[CLS] weevil injures himself , but finds himself unable to receive adequate benefits . [SEP] veronica gets piz to accept her leaving for the internship . [SEP]
[CLS] at the sheriff ’ s station , weevil is called out by several students as being the one who gave them the fake cards . [SEP] weevil is put in the jail cell , but he tells veronica that he think they targeted him after he was showcased in the criminology class . [SEP]
[CLS] she investigates several of the owners of the student ids , who do seem genuine in accusing weevil . [SEP] weevil gets bail , but keith informs him that a student id printing machine was found in the locker next to weevil ’ s . [SEP]
[CLS] veronica and wallace speak to a mechanical engineering professor , who says that it would be impossible for weevil to be the culprit . [SEP] piz invites keith to appear on his show in an election special before keith informs veronica that weevil ’ s fingerprints were found all over the investigation . [SEP]
[CLS] keith and vinnie debate on piz ’ s radio show , and vinnie gathers some support about his lax underage drinking policy . [SEP] wallace notices someone following him , and the student wants to recruit him for a secret society . [SEP]
[CLS] vinnie insults keith ’ s handling of his home life , and veronica hits him on the head lightly . [SEP] she helps weevil retrace his steps and notices one of her criminology classmates , jenny ( dianna agron ) , involved with one of weevil ’ s clients . [SEP]
[CLS] veronica deduces that jenny and her circle of friends are responsible for creating the fake student ids , disseminating them , and implicating weevil . [SEP] logan and dick ( ryan hansen ) go surfing , and they run into veronica , piz , and mac helping wallace ( percy daggs iii ) with his final project for a class . [SEP]
[CLS] veronica learns that one of jenny ’ s group lives in the same town in georgia where the student id machines are made . [SEP] veronica is called into a room in the library by jenny ’ s group , who try to bribe her into not turning them in to the hearst police . [SEP]
[CLS] however , she denies and records their conversation as further proof . [SEP] they are hiding a third id machine , and veronica tells weevil to go and find it . [SEP]
[CLS] dick shows logan a sex tape of piz and veronica that has been circulating in an email . [SEP] because logan thinks piz posted the tape , he attacks piz and hits him incessantly . [SEP]
[CLS] weevil does have a student id machine , and logan walks into mars investigations with piz ’ s blood on him . [SEP] " weevils wobble [SEP]
[CLS] but they don ' t go down " was written by phil klemmer and directed by jason bloom , marking klemmer ' s fifteenth and final writing credit and bloom ' s fourth and final directing credit for veronica mars , after " green @ - @ eyed monster " , " nevermind the buttocks " , and " charlie don ' t surf " . [SEP] the episode features the final appearance of dianna agron , famous for her role as quinn fabray on glee , as jenny budosh , veronica ’ s classmate . [SEP]
[CLS] agron had previously appeared in the episode “ president evil ” . [SEP] the episode prominently features weevil ( francis capra ) , who appears after a five episode hiatus . [SEP]
[CLS] during the third season , capra was struggling with a medical condition , and the medication he took for this illness caused his face and neck to swell and break out with acne . [SEP] series creator rob thomas included the scene in which logan attacks piz on his list of highlights from the third season . [SEP]
[CLS] when thomas first viewed the scene with his wife , she emitted an audible groan when she saw logan walking through the cafeteria towards piz , anticipating the fight that was about to come . [SEP] thomas thought that most fight scenes on the show were not well @ - @ done , as they are filmed quickly and without a second unit . [SEP]
[CLS] however , he was pleased with the final cut , stating that there was only one punch that he thought looked fake . [SEP] in its original broadcast , “ weevils wobble [SEP]
