[CLS] still , better to go out with good episodes than bad . ” [SEP] temple beth israel ( hebrew : בית ישראל ) is a reconstructionist synagogue located at 1175 east 29th avenue in eugene , oregon . [SEP]
[CLS] founded in the early 1930s as a conservative congregation , beth israel was for many decades the only synagogue in eugene . [SEP] the congregation initially worshipped in a converted house on west eighth street . [SEP]
[CLS] it constructed its first building on portland street in 1952 , and occupied its current leed @ - @ compliant facilities in 2008 . [SEP] in the early 1990s conflict between feminist and traditional members led to the latter leaving beth israel , and forming the orthodox congregation ahavas torah . [SEP]
[CLS] beth israel came under attack from neo @ - @ nazi members of the volksfront twice , in 1994 and again in 2002 . [SEP] in both cases the perpetrators were caught and convicted . [SEP]
[CLS] services were lay @ - @ led for decades . [SEP] marcus simmons was hired as the congregation ' s first rabbi in 1959 , but left in 1961 . [SEP]
[CLS] after a gap of two years , louis neimand became rabbi in 1963 , and served until his death in 1976 . [SEP] he was followed by myron kinberg , who served from 1977 to 1994 , and kinberg in turn was succeeded by yitzhak husbands @ - @ hankin . [SEP]
[CLS] maurice harris joined husbands @ - @ hankin as associate rabbi in 2003 , and served until 2011 , when he was succeeded by boris dolin . [SEP] as of 2014 , led by husbands @ - @ hankin and dolin , beth israel had approximately 400 member households , and was the largest synagogue in eugene . [SEP]
[CLS] small numbers of german jews began settling in eugene in the late 19th century , but most moved on . [SEP] in the early 20th century the first eastern european jews settled there , and by the 1920s eugene ' s jewish community began gathering prayer quorums for holding friday night and jewish holiday services in individuals ' homes . [SEP]
[CLS] historian steven lowenstein writes that " [ a ] fter hymen rubenstein ' s death in 1933 , his home at 231 west eighth street was remodeled and named temple beth israel " . [SEP] it was a traditional conservative synagogue , and from that time until the 1990s it was the only synagogue in eugene . [SEP]
[CLS] in 1952 , the congregation constructed a one @ - @ story synagogue building on an almost 1 acre ( 0 @ . @ 40 ha ) property at 2550 portland street . [SEP] designed by architect and holocaust @ - @ survivor heinrich hormuth ( h . h . ) waechter , the building featured an interior courtyard that provided natural lighting , and " a network of ceiling beams painted with symbols and shapes " by waechter . [SEP]
[CLS] temple beth israel ' s services and religious functions were lay @ - @ led for decades . [SEP] its first rabbi was marcus simmons . [SEP]
[CLS] originally from england , he was a graduate of university of london and oxford university , and was ordained at the hebrew theological seminary . [SEP] he emigrated to the united states in 1957 , and joined beth israel in 1959 . [SEP]
[CLS] the members were not , however , agreed that a full @ - @ time rabbi was required , and in 1961 , he accepted a rabbinical position in downey , california . [SEP] following a hiatus of two years , louis neimand was hired as rabbi in 1963 . [SEP]
[CLS] born in new york city in 1912 to immigrant parents , he was a graduate of city university of new york and was ordained at the jewish institute of new york . [SEP] he had previously worked for the united jewish appeal , and from 1959 to 1963 was the first hillel rabbi at syracuse university . [SEP]
[CLS] there was some concern about neimand ' s hiring , as he had a police record as a result of his involvement in freedom marches in the african @ - @ american civil rights movement ( 1955 – 1968 ) . [SEP] he served until his death in 1976 . [SEP]
[CLS] myron kinberg was hired as rabbi in 1977 . [SEP] ordained in reform judaism , he had previously served as a rabbi in topeka , kansas for two years , then lived in israel for two years , before coming to eugene . [SEP]
[CLS] kinberg was known for his support for minority rights and gay rights , anti @ - @ nuclear and anti @ - @ war activism , support of reconciliation between israel and the palestinians , and outreach to non @ - @ observant members of eugene ' s jewish community . [SEP] kinberg attempted to revive the biblical concept of the " ger toshav " in his approach to intermarriage . [SEP]
[CLS] he was willing to officiate at an intermarriage if the non @ - @ jewish partner , after discussions with the rabbi , agreed of his or her own free will to fulfill a set of commitments , including " a commitment to a jewish home life , participation in jewish life and tradition , and raising future children as jews " . [SEP] the non @ - @ jewish partner making this commitment became a " ger toshav " , or " non @ - @ jewish member of the jewish people " . [SEP]
[CLS] kinberg ' s wife alice was a strong feminist , and during the 1980s he and his wife supported a number of changes to the liturgy and ritual . [SEP] these included allowing women to read from the torah and lead the prayers , and changing prayers to be more gender inclusive - for example , using gender @ - @ neutral terms and pronouns for god , and adding references to the biblical matriarchs in prayers like the amidah , which traditionally only mentioned the biblical patriarchs . [SEP]
[CLS] while most congregation members approved of these changes , a minority resisted them . [SEP] by the early 1990s serious divisions developed among the members of the congregation over a number of issues , including personal antagonisms , the rabbi ' s activism and " advocacy of ' ultra @ - @ liberal ' causes " , political differences over the israeli – palestinian conflict , and a myriad of additional jewish cultural / religious issues , such as the acceptance of intermarried couples , adherence to kosher dietary laws , the use of modern language and music during worship services , rewriting of certain prayers such as the aleynu to make them less ethnocentric , and so on . [SEP]
[CLS] however , the biggest source of division , which underlay all others , was " the roles and rights of men and women in the synagogue . " [SEP] in the early 1990s a group of newly observant members began holding more traditional services in a back room of the synagogue , complete with a mechitza , a partition separating men and women . [SEP]
[CLS] the " more feminist @ - @ minded " members strongly objected to having a mechitza anywhere in the temple beth israel building , even if it were not in the services they attended . [SEP] the latter group eventually circulated a petition which stated that either the mechitza would have to be taken down , or those members who wanted it would have to leave . [SEP]
[CLS] kinberg also signed the petition . [SEP] faced with this opposition , in 1992 the orthodox members left , renting new premises and hiring their own rabbi , creating eugene ' s second synagogue , originally called " the halachic minyan " , and in 1998 renamed " congregation ahavas torah " . [SEP]
[CLS] kinberg held himself responsible , and the schism led to his " reassessment of the needs of temple beth israel and his role as a rabbi " . [SEP] as a result , he left beth israel in 1994 to lead a synagogue on long island . [SEP]
[CLS] during his tenure at beth israel , membership rose from 118 to 350 families . [SEP] kinberg died two years later at age 51 . [SEP]
[CLS] yitzhak husbands @ - @ hankin succeeded kinberg in 1995 . [SEP] husbands @ - @ hankin began his involvement at temple beth israel first as a congregant , then as cantor , and then as an assistant rabbi . [SEP]
[CLS] he was active in forming the jewish renewal movement , and was ordained by its leader zalman schachter @ - @ shalomi . [SEP] the congregation decided to leave the conservative movement in 1995 , and for a year had no affiliation . [SEP]
[CLS] in late 1996 , after considering both reform and reconstructionist as alternatives , the congregation affiliated with the reconstructionist movement . [SEP] by 1999 , membership had grown to around 370 families . [SEP]
[CLS] husbands @ - @ hankin was instrumental in developing the concept of " ethical kashrut " , the idea that one should only purchase goods that are produced in an ethical way . [SEP] his essay , " ethical kashrut , " was selected for publication in arthur kurzweil ' s best jewish writing 2003 . [SEP]
[CLS] a singer , cello and guitar player , he composes and performs jewish music . [SEP] husbands @ - @ hankin has had four assistant or associate rabbis working with him . [SEP]
[CLS] shoshana spergel joined temple beth israel in 1998 as interim rabbi when husbands @ - @ hankins went on a sabbatical ; jonathan seidel was assistant rabbi from 2001 to 2003 . [SEP] maurice harris , a 2003 graduate of the reconstructionist rabbinical college , joined as assistant rabbi in 2003 . [SEP]
[CLS] he is one of the signators of the open letter concerning religion and science from american rabbis , part of the clergy letter project which " encourages and embraces the teaching of evolution in schools " . [SEP] in 2011 , boris dolin joined the congregation as its newest associate rabbi . [SEP]
[CLS] on march 20 , 1994 , chris lord , an individual associated with the volksfront and american front , fired ten rounds with an assault rifle into the temple , damaging the interior . [SEP] the attacks were prompted by a newspaper article about several members of eugene ' s jewish community , including a lesbian . [SEP]
[CLS] community organizations , including a local gay rights group , responded by standing vigil outside the synagogue during passover services . [SEP] lord and an associate were caught and convicted , and lord was sentenced to four and a half years in prison . [SEP]
[CLS] on october 25 , 2002 jacob laskey , his brother gabriel laskey , gerald poundstone , jesse baker , and one other man , all members of the volksfront , drove to beth israel with the intent of intimidating the congregants . [SEP] while a service with 80 members attending was taking place , the men threw rocks etched with nazi swastikas through the synagogue ' s stained glass windows , then sped off . [SEP]
[CLS] the men were caught , pleaded guilty , and were convicted . [SEP] they served sentences ranging from a 6 @ - @ month work release term and five years probation , to eleven years and three months in federal prison for the ringleader , jacob laskey . [SEP]
[CLS] originally sized for 75 families , temple beth israel ' s portland street building had been renovated and enlarged over the years to 7 @ , @ 500 square feet ( 700 m2 ) to accommodate 250 families and 150 students . [SEP] despite these additions and the loss of members to congregation ahavas torah , the synagogue was not large enough , particularly during the high holidays , when extra space had to be rented . [SEP]
[CLS] in 1997 the congregation purchased the property of the university street christian church for $ 500 @ , @ 000 ( today $ 740 @ , @ 000 ) , and began planning for a new facility . [SEP] the members considered renovating the existing building on the property , but felt a new building would better suit their requirements , and razed the church . [SEP]
[CLS] in 2003 the congregation got a permit to begin construction of a new facility on the now @ - @ vacant 1 @ . @ 37 @ - @ acre ( 0 @ . @ 55 ha ) plot of land at the northwest corner of east 29th avenue and university street . [SEP] an initial capital campaign raised more than $ 1 @ . @ 8 million , which fully paid for the land , and by august 2007 an additional $ 1 @ . @ 7 million had been raised towards anticipated overall project costs of $ 5 million . [SEP]
[CLS] the environmentally sensitive building was designed by mel solomon and associates of kansas city and local company tbg architects & planners , and built by mckenzie commercial construction of eugene . [SEP] the building used " energy efficient heating , ventilation and lighting " : specific design issues with the building ' s energy efficiency included the fact that the largest room in the building , the sanctuary , was also the least @ - @ used , and , in accord with jewish tradition , had to face east ( towards jerusalem ) . [SEP]
[CLS] on june 8 , 2008 the congregation dedicated its new building at 1175 east 29th avenue . [SEP] at approximately 25 @ , @ 000 square feet ( 2 @ , @ 300 m2 ) , the facility included a sanctuary , commercial kitchen , banquet facilities , and classrooms , and housed the synagogue , the lane county jewish federation , and the local jewish family service . [SEP]
[CLS] the project ended up costing $ 6 million , of which $ 4 million had been raised . [SEP] made of concrete , steel , and wood , the building achieved leadership in energy and environmental design compliance " through the integration of stormwater management strategies , high efficiency irrigation , the use of recycled and / or recyclable materials , and drought tolerant plantings . " [SEP]
[CLS] completely recyclable materials used in the structure included carpeting and wood beams . [SEP] in 2008 , temple beth israel participated in banners across america , an " interfaith witness against torture coordinated by the national religious campaign against torture , " as part of the jewish campaign against torture . [SEP]
[CLS] organized by rabbis for human rights — north america in honor of torture awareness month , the jewish campaign included over 25 synagogues which hung banners protesting " the use of abusive interrogation techniques by the american military and intelligence community " . [SEP] that year , congregational membership reached almost 400 families , and the talmud torah and pre @ - @ school had about 200 and 40 students respectively . [SEP]
[CLS] the congregation sold the old synagogue building on portland street to security first ( portland street ) child development center for $ 815 @ , @ 000 in 2009 , carrying the center ' s financing . [SEP] the building was converted for use as an educational center , while retaining some of the original architectural elements . [SEP]
[CLS] difficult economic conditions forced the child development center to give up the building in 2011 , and eugene ' s network charter school planned to move into it in autumn 2011 . [SEP] harris announced he would be stepping down as rabbi in 2011 , and the synagogue hired boris dolin as his successor . [SEP]
[CLS] born and raised in oregon , dolin had worked at temple beth israel as a teacher and youth group adviser from 1999 to 2001 . [SEP] a graduate of the university of oregon , with a master ' s degree in jewish education from the jewish theological seminary , he was ordained by the reconstructionist rabbinical college . [SEP]
[CLS] as of 2011 , temple beth israel was the largest synagogue in eugene . [SEP] it was a member of the community of welcoming congregations , " an oregon and sw washington interfaith ministry and advocacy organization working toward full inclusion and equality for transgender , lesbian , bisexual , gay and questioning persons . " [SEP]
[CLS] the rabbis were yitzhak husbands @ - @ hankin and boris dolin . [SEP] new york state route 93 ( ny 93 ) is a 43 @ . @ 08 @ - @ mile ( 69 @ . @ 33 km ) state highway in western new york in the united states . [SEP]
[CLS] the route begins at an intersection with ny 18f in the village of youngstown and runs in a general northwest – southeast direction across niagara and erie counties to its east end at an intersection with ny 5 in the town of newstead , just south of the village of akron . [SEP] ny 93 serves as a connector between several major arterials , including ny 104 in cambria , ny 31 just west of the city of lockport , and ny 78 south of the city . [SEP]
[CLS] the route was assigned as part of the 1930 renumbering of state highways in new york . [SEP] although it began in youngstown and ended in newstead as it does today , the initial routing of ny 93 deviated from the modern path in the vicinity of the city of lockport . [SEP]
[CLS] from cambria to lockport ' s eastern suburbs , the highway originally used ny 425 , lower mountain road , akron road , and a series of streets in lockport . [SEP] ny 93 was moved onto ny 104 and junction road in cambria in the 1940s , and altered to bypass lockport to the south on a new highway and robinson and dysinger roads in 1991 . [SEP]
[CLS] in 2006 , ny 93 was realigned west of lockport to continue south on junction road to ny 31 . [SEP] the change removed ny 93 from upper mountain road , a county @ - @ owned highway that had been part of the route since the 1930s . [SEP]
[CLS] ny 93 begins at an intersection with ny 18f ( main street ; co @ - @ designated but not signed as county route 907 or cr 907 ) in the center of the village of youngstown . [SEP] the route proceeds eastward through the village as a two @ - @ lane road named lockport street , serving two blocks of commercial areas before bending to the northeast and passing into the residential eastern portion of youngstown . [SEP]
[CLS] at the eastern village limits , ny 93 briefly widens to four lanes as it enters a partial cloverleaf interchange with the niagara scenic parkway . [SEP] past the junction , the highway reverts to a two @ - @ lane road and changes names to youngstown – lockport road as it runs across the town of porter . [SEP]
[CLS] the residential surroundings continue to the hamlet of towers corners , where ny 93 connects to ny 18 ( creek road ) . [SEP] after ny 18 , ny 93 curves to the southeast , serving another residential stretch ahead of a junction with youngstown – wilson road ( cr 36 ) on the eastern edge of towers corners . [SEP]
[CLS] after this intersection , the homes give way to farms as the road heads into rural areas of the town . [SEP] the route continues on a southeast track through porter , passing a mixture of rural and residential areas on its way into the hamlet of porter center , where ny 93 enters an intersection with porter center road ( cr 57 ) . [SEP]
[CLS] another southeastward stretch brings the route across twelvemile creek and into the hamlet of ransomville , where ny 93 becomes the community ' s main street . [SEP] through ransomville , ny 93 retains the youngstown – lockport road name , intersecting with ransomville road ( cr 17 ) in the hamlet ' s business district . [SEP]
[CLS] just outside ransomville , ny 93 leaves the town of porter for the town of wilson . [SEP] it continues generally southeastward across mostly open terrain , meeting randall road ( cr 83 ) and church street ( cr 56 ) on its way to the town of cambria . [SEP]
[CLS] ny 93 becomes north ridge road at the town line , and it soon enters the hamlet of north ridge , a community built up around the route ' s intersection with ny 425 ( cambria – wilson road ) . [SEP] the hamlet ' s residential surroundings continue to the adjacent community of molyneaux corners , where ny 93 becomes concurrent with ny 104 ( ridge road ) . [SEP]
[CLS] ny 93 and ny 104 proceed northeast across lightly populated areas for 2 miles ( 3 @ . @ 2 km ) to the hamlet of warren corners , at which point ny 93 splits from ny 104 and heads southward along town line road . [SEP] it immediately intersects with stone road ( cr 19 ) before leaving the hamlet . [SEP]
[CLS] outside of warren corners , the route heads across rural areas along the cambria – lockport town line . [SEP] it soon enters the small hamlet of hickory corners , where the road passes under lower mountain road ( cr 902 ) . [SEP]
[CLS] access to the highway is made by way of town line road spur ( cr 114 ) , a connector leading to lower mountain road . [SEP] ny 93 continues southward along the town line , changing names to junction road at an intersection with upper mountain road ( cr 5 ) west of the city of lockport . [SEP]
[CLS] from here , the route crosses over csx transportation ' s lockport subdivision rail line at the hamlet of lockport junction before intersecting with ny 31 ( saunders settlement road ) and ny 270 ( campbell boulevard ) just south of the community . [SEP] ny 270 begins straight ahead to the south while ny 93 turns northeast onto saunders settlement road , beginning a concurrency with ny 31 . [SEP]
[CLS] now fully in the town of lockport , ny 31 and ny 93 proceed northeast through an open area of the town as a four @ - @ lane divided highway . [SEP] the two routes continue to the western edge of the city of lockport , where they intersect with upper mountain road and the lockport bypass . [SEP]
[CLS] the overlap ends here as ny 93 turns southeastward onto the two @ - @ lane bypass . [SEP] along the bypass , ny 93 briefly enters the city limits as it runs past several industrial facilities and intersects with hinman road ( cr 903 ) just ahead of a bridge over the erie canal . [SEP]
[CLS] past the waterway , the bypass takes a more southerly course through an undeveloped part of the town of lockport to a junction with robinson road ( cr 123 ) on the lockport – pendleton town line . [SEP] the lockport bypass ends here , leaving ny 93 to turn eastward onto robinson road . [SEP]
[CLS] the route initially serves a line of homes as it heads along robinson road ; however , it soon enters a commercial district surrounding the road ' s intersection with ny 78 ( transit road ) . [SEP] at this point , the lockport – pendleton town line turns south to follow ny 78 , leaving ny 93 fully within the town of lockport as it runs eastward past another stretch of homes . [SEP]
[CLS] not far from ny 78 , ny 93 changes names to dysinger road at an intersection with beattie avenue ( cr 14 ) and raymond road ( cr 85 ) . [SEP] the junction also marks a shift in the road ' s surroundings as the homes give way to open , rolling terrain . [SEP]
[CLS] ny 93 continues eastward for several miles to the town of royalton , where it meets riddle road ( cr 35 ) and akron road ( cr 142 ) at adjacent intersections just east of the town line . [SEP] ny 93 takes over akron road ' s name and right @ - @ of @ - @ way , continuing eastward past a line of scattered homes to reach the sparsely developed hamlet of dysinger . [SEP]
[CLS] here , the route turns southward at a junction with bunker hill road ( cr 136 ) . [SEP] outside of dysinger , ny 93 heads southeastward across undeveloped areas of royalton , connecting to block church road ( cr 110 ) as it approaches tonawanda creek and the niagara – erie county line . [SEP]
[CLS] the road runs along the northern edge of the creek for about 1 @ . @ 5 miles ( 2 @ . @ 4 km ) prior to curving southward at an intersection with wolcottsville road ( cr 122 ) . [SEP] the turn brings ny 93 across tonawanda creek and into the erie county town of newstead , where it becomes known as maple road and immediately intersects with cr 260 ( koepsel road ) . [SEP]
[CLS] continuing southward , ny 93 runs across open , rolling terrain , meeting cr 259 ( tonawanda creek road ) on its way to the hamlet of swifts mills . [SEP] here , the rural surroundings briefly give way to residential areas as ny 93 intersects with cr 255 ( swift mills road ) in the center of the community . [SEP]
[CLS] south of swifts mills , the road serves only intermittent stretches of homes for 2 miles ( 3 @ . @ 2 km ) , including a cluster of residences around its closely spaced intersections with cr 253 ( carney road ) and cr 42 ( rapids road ) . [SEP] it continues on a southward track past the eastern terminus of cr 218 ( hunts corner – akron road ) to the outskirts of the village of akron , where the highway turns east onto lewis road and soon enters the village limits . [SEP]
[CLS] ny 93 runs past a line of homes before intersecting cedar street , a road maintained by erie county as cr 261 north of the village . [SEP] the route turns south at cedar street , following the residential street into downtown akron . [SEP]
[CLS] here , ny 93 intersects with cr 573 ( john street ) at a junction that was once the western terminus of ny 267 . [SEP] at this intersection , ny 93 heads west on john street for one block before continuing south on buffalo street for another block to main street . [SEP]
[CLS] ny 93 turns westward again , following main street through the westernmost part of akron ' s central business district prior to curving southwestward at a junction with mechanic street . [SEP] the highway takes on the mechanic street name as it crosses over murder creek and leaves downtown akron . [SEP]
[CLS] just south of the creek , ny 93 changes names to buell street at an intersection with jackson street . [SEP] as the route continues southward through the southern part of akron , it serves mostly residential areas , save for an industrial complex at ny 93 ' s intersection with cr 163 ( clarence center road ) and cr 167 ( parkview drive ) . [SEP]
[CLS] ny 93 exits akron a short distance south of the junction , at which point the route heads into another area of open fields while retaining the buell street name . [SEP] it continues on a southward track for about 1 mile ( 1 @ . @ 6 km ) to a commercialized intersection with ny 5 ( main road ) , where buell street and ny 93 both come to an end . [SEP]
[CLS] ny 93 was established as part of the 1930 renumbering of state highways in new york , connecting the cities and villages of youngstown , lockport , and akron . [SEP] while the termini of ny 93 have remained the same to this day , several portions of the route have been realigned since that time . [SEP]
[CLS] when ny 93 was first assigned , it turned south at the hamlet of north ridge and overlapped with ny 425 along cambria – wilson road to lower mountain road , then part of ny 3 . [SEP] ny 425 went west from this junction while ny 93 headed eastward , following ny 3 along lower mountain , gothic hill , upper mountain , and saunders settlement roads to the city of lockport . [SEP]
[CLS] at locust street , ny 93 left ny 3 and exited the city along locust , high , and akron streets and akron road . [SEP] it met its current alignment southeast of the city in royalton . [SEP]
[CLS] ny 3 was realigned c . [SEP] 1932 to follow saunders settlement road between shawnee road ( ny 425 ) and upper mountain road . [SEP]
[CLS] the former routing of ny 3 along shawnee , lower mountain , gothic hill , and upper mountain roads was redesignated as ny 3a even though all of ny 3 ' s former routing was already part of either ny 425 or ny 93 . [SEP] the ny 3a designation was eliminated c . [SEP]
[CLS] 1935 when ny 3 was truncated eastward to a new western terminus in central new york . [SEP] in the early 1940s , ny 93 was altered to follow north ridge road , u . s . route 104 ( now ny 104 ) , and junction road between north ridge and lower mountain road . [SEP]
[CLS] around the same time that ny 93 was rerouted , ny 270 was also extended northward along junction road from ny 31 to us 104 . [SEP] as a result , ny 93 overlapped ny 270 between lower mountain road and us 104 . [SEP]
[CLS] the overlap with ny 270 remained in place until c . [SEP] 1963 when ny 270 was truncated southward to the intersection of lower mountain and junction roads . [SEP]
[CLS] ny 93 was realigned in the late 1970s to bypass lower mountain and gothic hill roads on junction and upper mountain roads , replacing ny 270 along junction road . [SEP] the lower mountain road portion of ny 93 ' s former routing is now maintained by niagara county as county route 902 ( cr 902 ) . [SEP]
[CLS] the lockport bypass , a highway bypassing downtown lockport to the southwest , was opened to traffic on july 26 , 1991 . [SEP] the highway cost $ 7 @ . @ 7 million ( equivalent to $ 13 @ . @ 4 million in 2016 ) to construct and extended from the junction of ny 31 and ny 93 west of the city to robinson road south of downtown . [SEP]
[CLS] ny 93 was realigned to follow the new bypass south to robinson road , where it turned east and followed robinson road ( cr 123 ) and dysinger road ( cr 133 ) to akron road in royalton . [SEP] the portion of akron road ( ny 93 ' s former routing ) east of the lockport city limits became ny 954m , an unsigned reference route . [SEP]
[CLS] ownership and maintenance of robinson road from the bypass to ny 78 was transferred from niagara county to the state of new york on september 1 , 1990 , as part of a highway maintenance swap between the two levels of government . [SEP] the portion of ny 93 between ny 78 and akron road became state @ - @ maintained on october 1 , 1998 , as part of another swap that also transferred ownership and maintenance of akron road to niagara county . [SEP]
[CLS] akron road is now cr 142 . [SEP] on november 1 , 2005 , the niagara county legislature voted on a measure to allow the county to ask the new york state department of transportation ( nysdot ) to remove the ny 93 designation from upper mountain road , a county @ - @ maintained highway , and reassign it to junction road ( ny 270 ) and saunders settlement road ( ny 31 ) . [SEP]
[CLS] the impetus for the change came from a resident of upper mountain road , who demanded that trucks should be removed from the roadway . [SEP] this part of the agenda was passed . [SEP]
[CLS] nysdot obliged to the request in 2006 , rerouting ny 93 as proposed and truncating ny 270 southward to ny 31 . [SEP] operation usa ( opusa , operation california , or opcal ) is a non profit humanitarian organization dedicated to helping communities alleviate the effects of disaster , disease , and endemic poverty throughout the world by providing privately funded relief , reconstruction , humanitarian aid and development aid . [SEP]
[CLS] it is exclusively privately funded , receiving no assistance from the united states federal government . [SEP] opusa had a revenue of over $ 22 million in fiscal year 2012 and has shipped over $ 425 million worth of " high @ - @ priority medical , nutritional and shelter supplies " since its inception , including shipments to haiti , japan , chile , kenya and pakistan in 2011 and 2011 . [SEP]
[CLS] operation usa was part of the international campaign to ban landmines in 1997 when it won the nobel peace prize . [SEP] operation california was also the winner of the 1983 president ' s volunteer action award . [SEP]
[CLS] operation usa has been named one of america ' s best 100 charities by worth magazine and , in october 2008 , was named the top @ - @ rated " exclusively privately funded charity in the u . s . " by charity navigator . [SEP] operation usa collaborated with nasa ' s jet propulsion laboratory and the us national laboratories at lawrence livermore and los alamos to develop new approaches to land mine detection , is a member of interaction , and is an alertnet news partner . [SEP]
[CLS] in 2014 operation usa ' s ceo richard m . walden received the honeywell hometown hero award from the honeywell corp . operation california began in 1979 as " a relief organization created to provide aid to vietnamese boat people and cambodian refugees " , founded by richard walden ( still active as president & ceo ) and llewellyn werner ( who left in early 1980 ) . [SEP] the organization flew " the first international relief airlift to cambodia since 1975 " , delivering medicine to phnom @ - @ penh . [SEP]
[CLS] operation california had airlifted more than $ 3 million worth of aid by october 1979 . [SEP] since then , operation usa has become a highly acclaimed aid organization that is involved in helping people in different ways around the world . [SEP]
[CLS] in 1982 , operation california sent " the first private airlift from the u . s . to poland " , delivering 200 @ , @ 000 lbs . [SEP] of medical supplies and medicine ; that year operation california also airlifted medical supplies to lebanon . [SEP]
[CLS] in 1983 , operation california delivered aid to the children of vietnam and cambodia . [SEP] operation california provided aid to the earthquake victims in mexico city in 1985 , as well as working in cooperation with the unitarian universalist service committee and oxfam america , to deliver $ 250 @ , @ 000 worth of medical aid to nicaragua . [SEP]
[CLS] in 1986 operation california , in conjunction with medical aid to el salvador , sent " [ t ] wo cargo planes carrying $ 500 @ , @ 000 worth of relief supplies to earthquake @ - @ stricken el salvador " . [SEP] in 1988 , operation california began using the name operation usa because it better described the effort and intent of the organization to represent the entire american people . [SEP]
[CLS] in 1989 operation usa facilitated operations on children in vietnam who had cleft palates by a los angeles @ - @ based plastic surgeon , dr stanley frileck . [SEP] medical aid effort was delivered to mexico in 1990 , by opusa in conjunction with ussr relief workers . [SEP]
[CLS] in 1991 opusa delivered aid to bangladesh . [SEP] opusa delivered aid to war torn somali ' s in 1993 . [SEP]
[CLS] in 1994 opusa provided earthquake relief . [SEP] in 1995 the organization provided aid to hurricane mitch survivors in honduras and nicaragua . [SEP]
[CLS] in 1999 opusa supplied aid to storm victims in mexico . [SEP] in 2003 opusa delivered aid to iraq war victims in the persian gulf . [SEP]
[CLS] the tsunami victims in sri lanka and indonesia were aided by opusa in 2004 , as well as the mexico city flood victims . [SEP] in 2008 , opusa has delivered aid to myanmar cyclone victims as well as chinese earthquake victims and flood victims in the midwest , usa . [SEP]
[CLS] in 2015 , opusa partners with universalgiving to raise fund for its project , which is to deliver recovery aid to nepal earthquake victims . operation usa , since the early 1980s , has relied on fundraising efforts featuring singers and celebrities . [SEP] these include concerts , dinners , and other events . [SEP]
[CLS] these promotions have featured : barbra streisand bonnie raitt carol burnett crosby , stills & nash don henley ed asner frank sinatra jack elliot jackson browne james garner john denver julie andrews kirk douglas michael jackson new american orchestra placido domingo ricardo montalban [SEP] ry cooder sharon stone the buena vista social club tony adams rosario dawson travelled with operation usa to nicaragua in 2008 . [CLS] george hamilton assisted with relief to the philippines typhoon haiyan in 2013 as did barbra streisand , rosario dawson , jackson browne , bill maher and judd apatow . [CLS] victor / victoria ( broadway ) eloise at the plaza ( disney tv ) [SEP] typhoon krosa , known in the philippines as typhoon vinta , was a typhoon that made landfall in the northern philippines in late october 2013 . [SEP]
[CLS] forming on october 27 near guam , the storm slowly intensified while moving westward . [SEP] krosa developed an eye and became a typhoon before striking luzon on october 31 . [SEP]
[CLS] the storm weakened over land , but re @ - @ intensified over the south china sea , reaching peak winds of 150 km / h ( 90 mph ) on november 2 off the southeast coast of china . [SEP] typhoon krosa stalled and encountered unfavorable conditions , resulting in quick weakening . [SEP]
[CLS] by november 3 , it had weakened to tropical storm status , and was no longer being warned on by the next day . [SEP] in northern luzon , krosa damaged 32 @ , @ 000 houses , including 3 @ , @ 000 that were destroyed , and caused four fatalities . [SEP]
[CLS] high winds and rainfall left p277 million ( php , $ 6 @ . @ 4 million usd ) in damage . [SEP] on october 27 , an area of convection with a broad circulation persisted southeast of guam , and slowly consolidated due to moderate wind shear and westerly outflow . [SEP]
[CLS] that day , the japan meteorological agency ( jma ) classified the system as a tropical depression about 380 km ( 235 mi ) to the southeast of hagatna , guam . [SEP] at 2100 utc on october 28 , the philippine atmospheric , geophysical and astronomical services administration ( pagasa ) began issuing advisories on the depression , giving it the local name vinta . [SEP]
[CLS] the next day , the jma upgraded the depression to tropical storm krosa ( 1329 ) , and the joint typhoon warning center ( jtwc ) also classified it as tropical depression 29w . [SEP] by that time , the storm was moving steadily westward due to the subtropical ridge to the north . [SEP]
[CLS] with the warm waters of the philippine sea , lessening wind shear , and improving outflow , krosa gradually strengthened , and the jtwc also upgraded krosa to tropical storm status on october 30 after an eye feature developed . [SEP] while approaching northern luzon on october 29 , krosa quickly intensified as the initial eye feature organized into a well @ - @ defined eye . [SEP]
[CLS] late on october 30 , the jtwc upgraded krosa to typhoon status , and the next day , both pagasa and jma followed suit . [SEP] on october 31 , krosa made landfall in northeastern luzon near cagayan , and developed a symmetric eyewall while initially moving over land . [SEP]
[CLS] land interaction weakened the eye by the time krosa emerged into the south china sea late on october 31 . [SEP] the next day , pagasa discontinued advisories after the typhoon exited the region . [SEP]
[CLS] convection rebuilt around the center , with continued favorable conditions allowing for restrengthening . [SEP] late on november 1 , a large eye redeveloped , and the jtwc estimated krosa attained peak 1 minute sustained winds of 185 km / h ( 115 mph ) . [SEP]
[CLS] early the next day , the jma also estimated the typhoon reached peak 10 minute winds of 140 km / h ( 85 mph ) . [SEP] later , increasing wind shear caused the eye to deteriorate , and krosa began slowing about 260 km ( 160 mi ) east @ - @ southeast of hong kong after reaching the western edge of the subtropical ridge . [SEP]
[CLS] after remaining nearly stationary , krosa began moving steadily to the west @ - @ southwest due to a new ridge . [SEP] the convection continued to weaken due to continued shear and cooler waters from upwelling , and krosa deteriorated to tropical storm status on november 3 . [SEP]
[CLS] the next day , the jtwc issued its final advisory after the circulation became exposed from the convection . [SEP] also on november 4 , the jma downgraded krosa to tropical depression status off the northeast vietnam coast . [SEP]
[CLS] the system dissipated at 0000 utc on november 5 . [SEP] before krosa struck the philippines , pagasa issued a number 3 warning signal for portions of northern luzon , where winds were expected to reach over 100 km / h ( 60 mph ) . [SEP]
[CLS] the agency noted for the potential for flooding and landslides . [SEP] high winds knocked down trees across luzon , and left about 80 % of cagayan province without power , as well as some areas without internet or cellphone service . [SEP]
[CLS] portions of the pan @ - @ philippine highway were blocked , and in lal @ - @ lo , cagayan , a car crashed into a gasoline truck due to power outages . [SEP] agriculture damage was estimated at p273 million ( php , $ 6 @ . @ 3 million usd ) , occurring just before the start of the harvest . [SEP]
[CLS] across the island , the typhoon damaged 32 @ , @ 745 houses , including 3 @ , @ 837 that were destroyed , forcing 65 @ , @ 648 people to evacuate to storm shelters . [SEP] overall , krosa killed four people in the philippines , and left p273 million ( php , $ 6 @ . @ 4 million usd ) in damage . [SEP]
[CLS] after the storm , workers quickly restored power lines , while the government provided monetary assistance to storm @ - @ ravaged families , after cagayan was declared a state of calamity . [SEP] members of the philippine military and department of public works and highways worked to clean up following the storm . [SEP]
[CLS] the china national meteorological centre issued a " yellow alert " , the second @ - @ lowest of the four level warning system , for hainan due to the threat of the storm . [SEP] the agency recommended boats to return to port . [SEP]
[CLS] agencies in vietnam also warned for the potential of heavy rainfall due to the dissipating tropical depression krosa , and released water from three dams to prevent overflow . [SEP] kirby ' s block ball is a 1995 action video game , a spin @ - @ off from the kirby series for the game boy portable console . [SEP]
[CLS] it is a breakout clone ; the player controls paddles along the screen ' s edge to knock a bouncing ball , kirby , into destructible bricks . [SEP] the game ' s 55 levels include power @ - @ ups , bonus rounds , and minigames . [SEP]
[CLS] kirby ' s block ball was developed by hal laboratory and nintendo r & d1 . [SEP] the team spent half a year revising the gameplay to match kirby ' s signature characteristics . [SEP]
[CLS] kirby ' s block ball was published by nintendo first in japan in 1995 , later in europe , and last in north america in 1996 . [SEP] reviewers considered the game an improvement on the breakout formula and praised its gameplay craftsmanship and incorporation of the kirby series . [SEP]
[CLS] it was included in multiple top game boy game lists and was later emulated on the nintendo 3ds virtual console . [SEP] the player controls paddles along the screen ' s edges to knock a bouncing ball , kirby , into destructible bricks . [SEP]
[CLS] the player loses a life if kirby hits the edge of the screen . [SEP] each of the game ' s eleven stages include five rounds of increasingly complex block patterns for kirby to clear . [SEP]
[CLS] the ten different block types vary in durability and points value . [SEP] a well @ - @ timed hit of the paddle gives kirby a powerful bounce to break through harder blocks . [SEP]
[CLS] another block type turns the remaining blocks into a bonus round that rewards the player for clearing the screen in the least amount of time . [SEP] the player can find warp stars that lead to minigames , such as air hockey , where the player can earn extra lives . [SEP]
[CLS] the rounds also include enemies to attack and avoid . [SEP] some enemies contain bonus items . [SEP]
[CLS] each stage ends in a boss fight . [SEP] with stone , needle , flame , and spark power @ - @ ups , kirby can transform to interact with blocks differently . [SEP]
[CLS] for instance , the spark power @ - @ up lets kirby break through otherwise indestructible blocks , and the needle lets kirby hit spikes once without losing a life . [SEP] the game has a themed frame and uses a wide palette of colors in @ - @ game when played with the super game boy . [SEP]
[CLS] the game was developed by hal laboratory with gunpei yokoi ' s nintendo r & d1 , and published by nintendo . [SEP] at one point in development , hal decided that the game did not feel like a kirby game . [SEP]
[CLS] the team spent six months completely revising the game under explicit instructions on how kirby should move . [SEP] kirby games contain elements of unrestricted , creative movement as a general theme . [SEP]
[CLS] kirby ' s block ball was released for the game boy first in japan in 1995 and later in europe ( 1995 ) and north america ( may 1996 ) . [SEP] it was later emulated on the nintendo 3ds virtual console , and released first in japan ( october 2011 ) and later in europe ( february 2012 ) and north america ( may 2012 ) . [SEP]
[CLS] on release , the four reviewers of electronic gaming monthly applauded kirby ' s block ball for modifying the breakout formula to create a new and enjoyable game . [SEP] they especially praised the unique power @ - @ ups , though crispin boyer and sushi x also felt the game was too short and easy . [SEP]
[CLS] nintendo power said they enjoyed block ball and its number of stages , but wondered how its eight megabits of memory were being used . [SEP] the magazine found the parts where kirby eats the unbreakable blocks to be innovative . [SEP]
[CLS] all six of the magazine ' s reviewers recommended the game . [SEP] ign wrote that the game was primarily remembered as " an arkanoid or breakout clone skinned with the kirby franchise " . [SEP]
[CLS] ign calculated an average reviewer score of 7 @ . @ 4 / 10 . [SEP] the kirby series became known for its number of non @ - @ platformer spin @ - @ offs , of which block ball was one , like kirby ' s pinball land and kirby ' s dream course . [SEP]
[CLS] kirby ' s spherical shape lent itself towards ball @ - @ like roles . [SEP] ign wrote that block ball was the first " truly out there " kirby spin @ - @ off , but that the game was too short . [SEP]
[CLS] planet game boy called it one of the original game boy ' s ten " all @ - @ time classics " and gamesradar placed it among the top 25 game boy games released . [SEP] they considered kirby ' s block ball an improvement upon alleyway , a game boy launch title and breakout clone . [SEP]
[CLS] ign recommended the game upon its 3ds rerelease both in general and for breakout fans . [SEP] nintendo world report recommended the game to players who like score attack games and called it the best version of breakout released . [SEP]
[CLS] retrospective reviewers found the game enjoyable and praised the craft behind the gameplay and kirby themes . [SEP] alternatively , kirby ' s block ball received the lowest rating on tim rogers ' s 2004 " yamanote scoring system for portable games " ( a metric by which he played a game while counting stops on the circular yamanote train line until he lost interest ) with a score of " one " stop . [SEP]
[CLS] he called it " too damned bland " . [SEP] in a retrospective review , jeuxvideo . com had high praise for the level design , graphics , and animations . [SEP]
[CLS] they also found the music excellent in comparison to the annoying and repetitive soundtrack of most breakout clones . [SEP] the magazine also liked how the game fit the kirby universe , apart from its increased difficulty — jeuxvideo . com occasionally had trouble hitting the slow @ - @ paced ball with precision .
